analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: phra ba bas kyang ches phra ba chen po bas kyang ches che ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: phra ba bas kyang ches phra ba chen po bas kyang ches che ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa lta bu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is more subtle than the subtle and greater than the great.‚Äù

original: rmongs pa de'i gnyen por gzugs nyid rnam pa bcu dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang re re zhing skye mched nyid du phye'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa de'i gnyen por gzugs nyid rnam pa bcu dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang re re zhing skye mched nyid du phye'o //
translated: The antidote to that delusion is the analysis of form into ten types and the analysis of mind and mental factors into separate bases.

original: de ltar na ril po phye bas ril por 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bdag tu 'dzin pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ril po phye bas ril por 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bdag tu 'dzin pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the delusion of grasping the aggregates as a whole, which precedes the grasping of a self, is eliminated.

original: kha cig ni gzugs dang sems dag la ste /üîΩrmongs so @49a * //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs dang sems dag la ste / rmongs so @49a * //
translated: Some grasp a self in form and mind.

original: zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the delusion of grasping the aggregates as a whole‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: de dag ni rmongs pa ldog par bya ba'i phyir khams bstan pa las gzugs rnam pa bcu dang / sems rnam pa bdun du phye nas bstan to //
analyzed: de dag ni rmongs pa ldog par bya ba'i phyir khams bstan pa las gzugs rnam pa bcu dang / sems rnam pa bdun du phye nas bstan to //
translated: In order to eliminate that delusion, the elements are taught by analyzing form into ten types and mind into seven types.

original: de la sems las byung ba dag la rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa chung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la sems las byung ba dag la rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa chung ba yin te /
translated: The confusion that is in regard to the mental factors is a small form of confusion.

original: dngos po phra ba dang rigs mthun ba la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po phra ba dang rigs mthun ba la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a confusion in regard to subtle things and those of the same type.

original: gang zhig gzugs la rmongs pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs la rmongs pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po yin te /
translated: The confusion that is in regard to form is a medium form of confusion.

original: dngos po rags shing rigs mthun pa la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rags shing rigs mthun pa la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a confusion in regard to gross things and those of the same type.

original: gang zhig gzugs dang sems dag la rmongs pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs dang sems dag la rmongs pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa chen po yin te /
translated: The confusion that is in regard to form and mind is a great form of confusion.

original: dngos po phra ba dang / rags pa dang / rigs mthun pa dang / mthun pa ma yin pa la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po phra ba dang / rags pa dang / rigs mthun pa dang / mthun pa ma yin pa la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a confusion in regard to subtle and gross things, those of the same type and those of a different type.

original: de ltar na phung po bstan pa 'dis 'jig tshogs la lta ba ril por 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can bzlog cing /
analyzed: de ltar na phung po bstan pa 'dis 'jig tshogs la lta ba ril por 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can bzlog cing /
translated: Thus, through this teaching on the aggregates, the entire view of the perishing aggregates is eliminated, along with its antecedent.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyang spangs pa yin no //
translated: And the afflictions that are its antecedent are also abandoned.

original: grag go'i sgra ni lugs gzhan bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag go'i sgra ni lugs gzhan bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding other systems.

original: bstan bcos gzhan dag las phung po la sogs pa bstan pa la dgongs nas gzhan bstan te /
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhan dag las phung po la sogs pa bstan pa la dgongs nas gzhan bstan te /
translated: Other treatises teach the aggregates, etc., with a different intention.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gcig pa nyid dang / byed po nyid dang / zab po nyid du 'dzin pa bsal ba'i sgo nas phung po la sogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gcig pa nyid dang / byed po nyid dang / zab po nyid du 'dzin pa bsal ba'i sgo nas phung po la sogs pa bstan te /
translated: The aggregates, etc., are taught in order to eliminate the grasping of identity, the grasping of the agent, and the grasping of profundity, respectively.

original: de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the grasping of self is preceded by the grasping of identity, etc.

original: dbang po dag kyang rnam gsum ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po dag kyang rnam gsum ste // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The faculties are also threefold.

original: 'dir dbang po dag ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dbang po dag ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the faculties are faith, etc.

original: de la gang zag dbang po rnon po'i dbang du byas nas ni phung po bstan te /
analyzed: de la gang zag dbang po rnon po'i dbang du byas nas ni phung po bstan te /
translated: The aggregates are taught with reference to a person of sharp faculties.

original: de ni dbang po rnon po'i phyir phung po'i dbye ba kho nas skye mched dang khams kyi dbye ba rtogs par nus so //
analyzed: de ni dbang po rnon po'i phyir phung po'i dbye ba kho nas skye mched dang khams kyi dbye ba rtogs par nus so //
translated: Because of his sharp faculties, he is able to understand the classification of the sense bases and elements by means of the classification of the aggregates alone.

original: gang zag dbang po 'bring po'i dbang du byas nas ni skye mched bstan te /
analyzed: gang zag dbang po 'bring po'i dbang du byas nas ni skye mched bstan te /
translated: The bases are taught from the perspective of beings of medium capacity.

original: dbang po 'bring po yin pa'i phyir bar ma skye mched kyi rab tu dbye bas khams dbye ba rtogs par nus so //
analyzed: dbang po 'bring po yin pa'i phyir bar ma skye mched kyi rab tu dbye bas khams dbye ba rtogs par nus so //
translated: Because they are of medium capacity, they are able to understand the classification of the elements by the classification of the intermediate bases.

original: gang zag dbang po rtul po'i dbang du byas nas ni khams bstan te /
analyzed: gang zag dbang po rtul po'i dbang du byas nas ni khams bstan te /
translated: The elements are taught from the perspective of beings of dullest capacity.

original: de ni dbang po rtul ba'i phyir ma bshad par rang gi blo'i nus pas mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de ni dbang po rtul ba'i phyir ma bshad par rang gi blo'i nus pas mi rtogs so //
translated: Because they are of dullest capacity, they are unable to understand without explanation by the power of their own minds.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na thams cad la phan gdags par byas nas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na thams cad la phan gdags par byas nas 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in this way, all are benefited.

original: 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are three types of desire.

original: 'dod pa ni mos pa'o //üîΩde la gzhung bsdus pa 'dod pa'i gang zag @49b gi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni mos pa'o // de la gzhung bsdus pa 'dod pa'i gang zag @49b gi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Desire is interest.

original: phung po bstan te /
analyzed: phung po bstan te /
translated: Among them, the aggregates are taught from the perspective of persons who desire a concise text.

original: de ni brjod bya nyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brjod bya nyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have little to express.

original: gzhung bar ma la dga' ba'i gang zag gi dbang du byas nas skye mched bstan la /
analyzed: gzhung bar ma la dga' ba'i gang zag gi dbang du byas nas skye mched bstan la /
translated: The bases are taught from the perspective of persons who desire a medium text.

original: gzhung rgya chen po 'dod pa'i gang zag gi dbang du byas nas ni khams bstan to //
analyzed: gzhung rgya chen po 'dod pa'i gang zag gi dbang du byas nas ni khams bstan to //
translated: The elements were taught for the sake of those who desire an extensive treatise.

original: yang ci'i phyir de dag de ltar 'dod par gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de dag de ltar 'dod par gyur zhe na ;
translated: Why do they assert them in that way?

original: sngon goms pa'i sbyor ba las te /üîΩgzhan du mos pa rnams la gzhan du chos bstan pa ni yid mi ches pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba kho na 'ba' zhig tu zad pas gdul ba'i mos pa'i khyad par las phung po la sogs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: sngon goms pa'i sbyor ba las te / gzhan du mos pa rnams la gzhan du chos bstan pa ni yid mi ches pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba kho na 'ba' zhig tu zad pas gdul ba'i mos pa'i khyad par las phung po la sogs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gsum bstan to //
translated: They assert them in that way due to prior habituation.

original: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: For those who have interest in other topics, teaching the Dharma in a different way is merely a cause for lack of confidence. Therefore the three topics of the aggregates and so on are taught due to the specific interest of those to be trained.üîΩWhy?

original: bsam pa ci zhig ce na /üîΩtshor ba dang 'du shes bzhin du sems pa la sogs pa rnams kyang logs shig tu phung po rnam par gzhag pa ci ste ma byas /
analyzed: bsam pa ci zhig ce na / tshor ba dang 'du shes bzhin du sems pa la sogs pa rnams kyang logs shig tu phung po rnam par gzhag pa ci ste ma byas /
translated: What is the intention?üîΩWhy are intention and so on not separately posited as aggregates like feeling and discernment?

original: yang na sems pa la sogs pa ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes gnyis kyang gcig tu ci'i phyir ma bzhag pa'i rgyu brjod par bya'o snyam pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sems pa la sogs pa ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes gnyis kyang gcig tu ci'i phyir ma bzhag pa'i rgyu brjod par bya'o snyam pa'o //
translated: Or why are feeling and discernment not combined into one aggregate like intention and so on?

original: rtsod pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa dang 'khor ba'i rgyu phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa dang 'khor ba'i rgyu phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
translated: The root of dispute and the cause of cyclic existence are explained at length.

original: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba dag ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba dag ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two roots of dispute:

original: 'dod ba la lhag par chags pa dang / lta ba la lhag par chags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod ba la lhag par chags pa dang / lta ba la lhag par chags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: attachment to desire and attachment to views.

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams ni phal cher go rims ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa dang lta ba dag la 'dun par 'dod chags dag 'dod par bya bas na 'dod chags dag ste /
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams ni phal cher go rims ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa dang lta ba dag la 'dun par 'dod chags dag 'dod par bya bas na 'dod chags dag ste /
translated: It is held that householders and those gone forth are, for the most part, attached to desire and views, respectively.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams so //
translated: Desire refers to objects such as form that are to be desired.

original: de dag la lhag par chags pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: de dag la lhag par chags pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment to those is attachment as clinging.

original: lta ba dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lta ba dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Views are the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: de dag la lhag par chags pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag la lhag par chags pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kho na'o //
translated: Attachment to those is attachment as clinging.

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i gtso bo ni go rims bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dag ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i gtso bo ni go rims bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dag ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The primary causes of those two are, respectively, feeling and discernment.

original: de gnyis kyi ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba la lhag par chags pa'i mchan nyid can rtsod pa'i rtsa ba gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba la lhag par chags pa'i mchan nyid can rtsod pa'i rtsa ba gnyis kyi'o //
translated: The two roots of dispute are the two: desire and view, which have the nature of attachment to desire and attachment to views.

original: gtso bo smos pa ni ma rig ba la sogs pa rnams kyang nge gnyis kyi rgyur 'gyur bas so ;
analyzed: gtso bo smos pa ni ma rig ba la sogs pa rnams kyang nge gnyis kyi rgyur 'gyur bas so ;
translated: The principal ones are mentioned, because ignorance, etc. are also the causes of those two.

original: / tshor ba ro myong ba'i dbang gis ni zhes bya ba la ro myang dam pas na zhes bshad pas na tshor ba nyid ro myang ba yin pas na tshor ba ro myang ba'o //
analyzed: / tshor ba ro myong ba'i dbang gis ni zhes bya ba la ro myang dam pas na zhes bshad pas na tshor ba nyid ro myang ba yin pas na tshor ba ro myang ba'o //
translated: Craving arises due to the power of the experience of feeling. Since it is explained that ‚Äúexperience‚Äù means ‚Äútasting,‚Äù the experience of feeling is the experience of feeling.

original: de ni ro mngar ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro myang ba ste /
analyzed: de ni ro mngar ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro myang ba ste /
translated: It is like a sweet taste, because it is an experience.

original: de'i dbang gis 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi sko nas 'dod ba la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi sko nas 'dod ba la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: Due to the power of that, one is attached to desire through the craving of desire.

original: de ltar na @50a * //
analyzed: de ltar na @50a * //
translated: Thus,

original: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni tshor ba yin no //
translated: the principal cause of attachment to desire is feeling.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis ni lta ba rnams la'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis ni lta ba rnams la'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: View is due to the power of distorted discernment.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: mngon par zhen la zhes bya ba skabs su bab par zad de /
analyzed: mngon par zhen la zhes bya ba skabs su bab par zad de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto manifest attachment‚Äù is appropriate here.

original: chos ma yin pa la chos su 'du shes pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa dag la bdag tu 'du shes pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa la chos su 'du shes pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa dag la bdag tu 'du shes pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang /
translated: The view of the self in regard to the selflessness of phenomena and so on is the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices, the afflicted view of the self, the extreme view, and the esteeming of views.

original: lta ba gcig tu 'dzin par lta ba de dang / de dag la mngon par zhen no //
analyzed: lta ba gcig tu 'dzin par lta ba de dang / de dag la mngon par zhen no //
translated: One manifests attachment to those views.

original: gang gi tshe bden pa mthong ba rnams la 'du shes yod kyang phyin ci log med pas lta ba la mngon bar zhen pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bden pa mthong ba rnams la 'du shes yod kyang phyin ci log med pas lta ba la mngon bar zhen pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: When one sees the truth, although one has discriminations, one does not have the view of manifest attachment, because one is not mistaken.

original: de'i phyir gang gis 'du shes phyin ci log tu byas pa de nyid lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis 'du shes phyin ci log tu byas pa de nyid lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, that which is mistaken discrimination is the cause of the view of manifest attachment.

original: de yod pa dang med pa dag gis yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pa dang med pa dag gis yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is the cause of the existence and nonexistence of existence and nonexistence.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis mun pa dang bral ba'i phyir na phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i rgyu ma rig pa ni lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis mun pa dang bral ba'i phyir na phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i rgyu ma rig pa ni lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: Since it is free from darkness by virtue of its non-obscuring nature, ignorance, which is the cause of distorted knowing, is not the cause of the adherence to views.

original: gang zhig de dang 'dres shing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'du shes de ni rgyu yin no //üîΩsmras pa / 'dam bying nya ni yang yang 'phar ba yis ;
analyzed: gang zhig de dang 'dres shing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'du shes de ni rgyu yin no // smras pa / 'dam bying nya ni yang yang 'phar ba yis ;
translated: Rather, the cause is the discernment that is mixed with that and has the aspect of grasping at signs.üîΩObjection: Just as a fish in muddy water

original: / chu ni rnyog par byed pa ji bzhin du //üîΩma rig pa dang rjes 'brel 'du shes kyis /
analyzed: / chu ni rnyog par byed pa ji bzhin du // ma rig pa dang rjes 'brel 'du shes kyis /
translated: churns up the water again and again,üîΩso too, the discernment that is connected with ignorance

original: rig pa sun 'byin byed pa'ang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: rig pa sun 'byin byed pa'ang de dang 'dra //
translated: defiles awareness.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis ni lta ba dag la mngon par zhen to zhes bya ba 'di rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis ni lta ba dag la mngon par zhen to zhes bya ba 'di rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that one adheres to views by the power of distorted discernment.

original: tshor ba la zhen pa ni tshor ba la chags pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la zhen pa ni tshor ba la chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment to feeling is attachment to feeling.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni phyin ci log tu mtshan mar 'dzin pa las so //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni phyin ci log tu mtshan mar 'dzin pa las so //
translated: Distorted discernment arises from distorted grasping at signs.

original: de la tshor ba la zhen cing sred pa la spyod pa ni 'khor ro //
analyzed: de la tshor ba la zhen cing sred pa la spyod pa ni 'khor ro //
translated: Those who experience feeling and craving revolve.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni lta ba la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni lta ba la spyod pa'o //
translated: Those who experience view have distorted perception.

original: tshor ba la zhen pa dang phyin ci log bzhis 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa kho na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'khor te /
analyzed: tshor ba la zhen pa dang phyin ci log bzhis 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa kho na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'khor te /
translated: Those who experience feeling and craving and who have distorted perception due to the four distortions are reborn in cyclic existence.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: blo ni phyin ci log gyur pas //üîΩrtse dgas 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro //
analyzed: blo ni phyin ci log gyur pas // rtse dgas 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro //
translated: Due to the distortion of the mind,

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: one goes to the realm of the gods through the peak of existence.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni phung po'i go rims kyi rgyu de'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni phung po'i go rims kyi rgyu de'o //
translated: That is, the order of the aggregates is the cause.

original: de nyid du bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid du bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That will be explained later.

original: rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs //
translated: The order is according to coarseness, affliction,

original: snod sogs don rnams ji bzhin no //üîΩ@50b zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: snod sogs don rnams ji bzhin no // @50b zhes bya bar ro //
translated: receptacle, etc., according to meaning.

original: phung po dag gis 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so zhes gong du bshad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po dag gis 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so zhes gong du bshad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since it was previously explained that all conditioned phenomena are included in the aggregates,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa dri ba smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa dri ba smos so //
translated: the question is asked, ‚ÄúWhy are the aggregates presented in that order?‚Äù

original: phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas //
translated: The unconditioned is not included in the aggregates.üîΩ

original: don du mi rung phyir ma bshad de /
analyzed: don du mi rung phyir ma bshad de /
translated: The unconditioned is not mentioned as a heap because it is not suitable as a meaning of the term heap.

original: phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas 'chad pa na /üîΩde dag kho na'i khongs su sdud par ram /
analyzed: phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas 'chad pa na / de dag kho na'i khongs su sdud par ram /
translated: If the unconditioned were mentioned as a heap,

original: de dag las tha dad par dag pa gzhan zhig tu rnam par 'jog //üîΩde yang nye bar len pa'i phung po dag gam /
analyzed: de dag las tha dad par dag pa gzhan zhig tu rnam par 'jog // de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po dag gam /
translated: it would have to be included in one of the heaps or it would have to be posited as a separate, pure heap.

original: phung po dag gi khongs su bsdus grang na /
analyzed: phung po dag gi khongs su bsdus grang na /
translated: Moreover, it would have to be included in the appropriating heaps or in the heaps.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not suitable in any way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not suitable?

original: don du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩre zhig phung po dag gi khongs su bsdu bar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: don du mi rung ba'i phyir ro // re zhig phung po dag gi khongs su bsdu bar ni mi nus te /
translated: Because it is not suitable as a meaning of the term heap.

original: de dag gi nye bar len pa'i don mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi nye bar len pa'i don mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It cannot be included in the heaps because it is not suitable as the meaning of appropriating the heaps.

original: de dag gi nye bar len pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dag yod na /
analyzed: de dag gi nye bar len pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dag yod na /
translated: The appropriating of the heaps is the existence of form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.

original: 'dus ma byas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te ;
translated: The unconditioned is not the entity of form, etc.,

original: ji ltar de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dag gis bsdu bar rigs /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dag gis bsdu bar rigs /
translated: How could it be reasonable to include it among the aggregates of form, etc., since it is not of the nature of those?

original: de nyid kyi phyir de de gzugs ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang ma yin pas zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de de gzugs ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang ma yin pas zhes bshad do //
translated: For this very reason, it is said that it is not form, nor is it up to consciousness.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: de ni gzugs su rung ba'i don gyis gzugs ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni gzugs su rung ba'i don gyis gzugs ma yin la /
translated: It is not form because it is not suitable as form.

original: myong ba'i don gyis tshor ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: myong ba'i don gyis tshor ba ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not feeling because it is not suitable as the meaning of experience.

original: 'dus te shes pa'i don gyis 'du shes ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dus te shes pa'i don gyis 'du shes ma yin la /
translated: It is not discernment because it is not suitable as the meaning of the aggregation of cognition.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i don gyis 'du byed ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i don gyis 'du byed ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not formation because it is not suitable as the meaning of formation.

original: rnam par rig pa'i don gyis rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i don gyis rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not consciousness because it is not suitable as the meaning of consciousness.

original: phung po drug par brjod pa yang mi nus so //
analyzed: phung po drug par brjod pa yang mi nus so //
translated: It is also not possible to speak of six aggregates.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: don du mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: don du mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not suitable as an object.

original: phung po'i don du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i don du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable as the meaning of an aggregate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don to zhes bshad na 'dus ma byas ni zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don to zhes bshad na 'dus ma byas ni zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúheap,‚Äù then unconditioned states are not aggregates, because they are not heaps.

original: de'i phyir phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas ma bshad de /üîΩspung bar byed pa ni phyogs nas 'gugs pa'am ;
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas ma bshad de / spung bar byed pa ni phyogs nas 'gugs pa'am ;
translated: Therefore, unconditioned states are not explained as aggregates.

original: dus las 'gugs pa zhig gi yin grang na /
analyzed: dus las 'gugs pa zhig gi yin grang na /
translated: If ‚Äúheap‚Äù means ‚Äúto gather from various directions‚Äù or ‚Äúto gather from various times,‚Äù

original: gnyis ka yang 'dus ma byas phyogs dang dus su ma gtogs pa la srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang 'dus ma byas phyogs dang dus su ma gtogs pa la srid pa ma yin no //
translated: then unconditioned states are not possible, because unconditioned states are not included in directions and times.

original: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, in order to understand the basis of affliction,

original: gzhi'i sgra ni 'dir rgyu'i rnam grangs te /üîΩzag pa dang bcas @51a * //
analyzed: gzhi'i sgra ni 'dir rgyu'i rnam grangs te / zag pa dang bcas @51a * //
translated: the term ‚Äúbasis‚Äù here is a synonym for ‚Äúcause.‚Äù

original: pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because conditioned states are the cause of affliction,

original: bya ba'i phyir sgra ni 'dir dgos pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir sgra ni 'dir dgos pa'i tshig go //
translated: the term ‚Äúfor the sake of‚Äù here is a term for purpose.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gzhi shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zag ba dang bcas pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la ;
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gzhi shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zag ba dang bcas pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la ;
translated: Because it is the basis of both defilement and purification.üîΩThe basis of defilement is the cause of defilement because contaminated states are the cause of defilement.

original: zag pa med pa rnams rnam par byang ba'i rgyu'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams rnam par byang ba'i rgyu'i phyir yin na /
translated: The basis of purification is the cause of purification because uncontaminated states are the cause of purification.

original: 'dus ma byas ni gnyis ka yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni gnyis ka yang ma yin no //
translated: But unconditioned states are neither.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyas par yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /üîΩzag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyas par yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ma yin te / zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not the cause of defilement because defilement does not increase through them.

original: lam gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i gzhi ma yin te /üîΩ'dis rnam par byang bar byed pas na rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i gzhi ma yin te / 'dis rnam par byang bar byed pas na rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: They are not the basis of purification because they are not the path.

original: lam la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: lam la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Purification is that which purifies because it is the path.üîΩSome say: Unconditioned states are not the basis of purification because they are not the path.

original: kha cig na re ji ltar bum pa chag pa bum pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: kha cig na re ji ltar bum pa chag pa bum pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Just as a broken pot is not a pot.

original: bum pa chag pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: bum pa chag pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa 'gags pa ste /
translated: A broken pot is a pot that has ceased.

original: bum pa ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po zhig pa ste /
analyzed: bum pa ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po zhig pa ste /
translated: Just as a broken pot is not a pot,

original: phung po 'gags pa so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa gnyis kyang phung po ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po 'gags pa so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa gnyis kyang phung po ma yin no //
translated: so the cessation of the aggregates, i.e., the cessation of the aggregates through analysis and the cessation of the aggregates without analysis, are not aggregates.

original: nam mkha' ni gcig kho na yin pa'i phyir phung po ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gcig kho na yin pa'i phyir phung po ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Space is not an aggregate because it is only one.

original: de dag gi ltar na khams dang skye mched dag la yang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na khams dang skye mched dag la yang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: According to them, the same would be true of the elements and sense spheres.

original: ji ltar bum pa chag pa bum pa ma yin pa de bzhin du khams dang skye mched zhig pa yang khams dang skye mched yin par mi 'os so zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa chag pa bum pa ma yin pa de bzhin du khams dang skye mched zhig pa yang khams dang skye mched yin par mi 'os so zhes bya bar ro //
translated: Just as a broken pot is not a pot, so the destruction of the elements and sense spheres is not proper as the elements and sense spheres.

original: phung po rnams kyi rnam pa gzhan bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rnam pa gzhan bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: We have explained the other aspects of the aggregates.

original: skye mched dang / khams dag las rnam pa gzhan du brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dag las rnam pa gzhan du brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the other aspects of the elements and sense spheres are mentioned.

original: phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas ma bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas ma bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The unconditioned is not explained as being included in the aggregates.

original: da ni go rims lhag mar lus pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni go rims lhag mar lus pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the remaining order will be discussed.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la dgongs pa mngon du ma btang ba'i chos ston pa mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la dgongs pa mngon du ma btang ba'i chos ston pa mi mnga' zhing /
translated: The Buddhas do not teach the Dharma without having in mind the ultimate.üîΩAnd here, the ultimate is not made clear.

original: dgongs pa yang 'dir gsal bar ma byas pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: dgongs pa yang 'dir gsal bar ma byas pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs //
translated: The order is according to grossness, defilement,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: Form is that which has resistance.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad pas rags te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad pas rags te /
translated: It is grosser than all the others, feeling, etc.,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dag ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir phra'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dag ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir phra'o //
translated: because the latter are subtler, since they are without resistance.

original: gzhan @51b dag na re rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rten yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dug gi yul yin pa'i phyir rags so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan @51b dag na re rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rten yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dug gi yul yin pa'i phyir rags so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is gross because it is the basis of the five consciousnesses, and because it is the object of the consciousnesses of the five sense organs.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi nang na yang nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi nang na yang nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Among the non-material aggregates, the order is according to grossness of the self-notion, etc.

original: tshor ba ni rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni lus med kyang rtogs par ches sla ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshor ba ni rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni lus med kyang rtogs par ches sla ba'i phyir te /
translated: Feeling is more gross in its movement, because it is easier to understand even without a body.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ltar nga'i lag pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ltar nga'i lag pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: That is why it is said, ‚ÄúIt is like this: I have pain in my hand.‚Äù

original: 'du shes ni gnyis pas ches rags pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gnyis pas te /
analyzed: 'du shes ni gnyis pas ches rags pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gnyis pas te /
translated: Discrimination is more gross than the next two, i.e., than formative influence and consciousness.

original: de'i bya ba rtogs par ches sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bya ba rtogs par ches sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its activity is easier to understand.

original: 'du shes ni skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Discrimination is the apprehension of the signs of male, female, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa pas ni 'du byed de ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa pas ni 'du byed de ci zhe na /
translated: Formative influence is more gross than consciousness.

original: rags te 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun du spyod pa te por gsal bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags te 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun du spyod pa te por gsal bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the manifestation of the conduct of attachment, etc. is easier to understand.

original: thams cad pas phra ba'i phyir na rnam par shes pas ni mthar te /
analyzed: thams cad pas phra ba'i phyir na rnam par shes pas ni mthar te /
translated: Consciousness is the most subtle of all.

original: 'dul ba rnams gzud pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir na rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin go rims yin no //
analyzed: 'dul ba rnams gzud pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir na rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin go rims yin no //
translated: The order is in accordance with the way of entry of the disciples and is in accordance with the way of understanding.

original: yang na thog ma med pa can gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang na thog ma med pa can gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Or, ‚Äúdue to beginningless cyclic existence‚Äù is the extensive explanation.

original: mo ni pho'i gzugs la mngon par dga' la /
analyzed: mo ni pho'i gzugs la mngon par dga' la /
translated: A female is attracted to the form of a male,

original: pho yang mo'i gzugs la mngon par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: pho yang mo'i gzugs la mngon par dga' ba ste /
translated: and a male is attracted to the form of a female.üîΩThey are attached to each other‚Äôs color, shape, voice, smell, taste, and tangible object.

original: phan tshun kha dog dang ; dbyibs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la mngon par zhen no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun kha dog dang ; dbyibs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la mngon par zhen no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de dag kyang tshor ba'i ro myang ba la mngon par chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag kyang tshor ba'i ro myang ba la mngon par chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are attached to the taste of the feeling.

original: pho dang mo dag phan tshun gzugs la mngon par dga' ba de dag ni tshor ba'i ro myang ba la chags ba las te /
analyzed: pho dang mo dag phan tshun gzugs la mngon par dga' ba de dag ni tshor ba'i ro myang ba la chags ba las te /
translated: Those who are attracted to each other‚Äôs form are attached to the taste of the feeling.

original: tshor ba thob pa dang ma thob pa nyid kyi phyir na chags pa dang mngon par chags pa las so //
analyzed: tshor ba thob pa dang ma thob pa nyid kyi phyir na chags pa dang mngon par chags pa las so //
translated: They are attached and strongly attached to the attainment and nonattainment of feeling.

original: de la chags pa yang 'du shes phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la chags pa yang 'du shes phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Attachment is due to the non-reversal of discrimination.

original: sdug bsngal ba la bde'o snyam pa ni 'du shes phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bde'o snyam pa ni 'du shes phyin ci log ste /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúThis is pleasant‚Äù is the reversal of discrimination.

original: tshor ba bde ba ni 'du byed dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dag gis sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba ni 'du byed dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dag gis sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Pleasant feeling is suffering by reason of the suffering of transformation and the suffering of the fact that everything that is conditioned is transitory.

original: phyin ci log de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyin ci log de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: And that error is due to the defilements.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log ste /
translated: There is error of ideation.

original: nyon mongs pa dag gis 'khrul bar byas ba ni 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag gis 'khrul bar byas ba ni 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The defilements cause error of ideation.

original: sems kyang de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa @52a * //
analyzed: sems kyang de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa @52a * //
translated: And the mind is defiled by them.

original: can du byas pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩji skad bshad pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: can du byas pa zhes bya ba la / ji skad bshad pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gis so //
translated: There is error of mind.üîΩThe defilements cause the mind to be defiled.

original: de'i phyir phung po rnams kyi go rims ni nyon mongs pa ji lta ba bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po rnams kyi go rims ni nyon mongs pa ji lta ba bzhin yin te /
translated: Therefore, the order of the aggregates is in accordance with the defilements.

original: gang nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gang gi don du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa ji lta ba bzhin go rims brjod do //
analyzed: gang nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gang gi don du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa ji lta ba bzhin go rims brjod do //
translated: The order of the defilements is stated according to the order of the defilements themselves, in order to indicate: that in regard to which there is defilement, the purpose for which there is defilement, that by which there is defilement, and that through which there is defilement.

original: yang na snod la sogs pa'i don gyis te zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang na snod la sogs pa'i don gyis te zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Alternatively, the order is stated according to the meaning of the words such as ‚Äòreceptacle‚Äô.

original: gzugs ni snod lta bu'o //üîΩsnod dang 'dra ba ni snod de /
analyzed: gzugs ni snod lta bu'o // snod dang 'dra ba ni snod de /
translated: Form is like a receptacle.

original: tshor ba zas kyi rten yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba zas kyi rten yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is like a receptacle because it is the support for the other four aggregates.

original: tshor ba ni zas lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni zas lta bu ste /
translated: Feeling is like food.

original: ro myang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro myang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like food because it is the basis for enjoyment.

original: phan pa dang gnod par 'jug pa'i phyir 'du shes ni tshod ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod par 'jug pa'i phyir 'du shes ni tshod ma lta bu'o //
translated: Ideation is like a seasoning because it engages in the discrimination of what is beneficial and harmful.

original: 'dis gsal bar byed pas na 'du shes ni tshod ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'dis gsal bar byed pas na 'du shes ni tshod ma lta bu ste /
translated: Ideation is like a seasoning because it is what makes something clear.

original: des yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas tshor ba gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: des yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas tshor ba gsal bar byed do //
translated: For, having apprehended the signs of what is agreeable and disagreeable, it makes feeling clear.

original: yang na 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis tshor ba'i ro mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir na 'du shes ni tshod ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang na 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis tshor ba'i ro mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir na 'du shes ni tshod ma lta bu'o //
translated: Or else, it is like a cook because it is the cause of the craving for the taste of sensation, due to the power of the perversion of ideation.

original: 'du byed rnams ni byan po lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni byan po lta bu ste /
translated: The formations are like the food,

original: de'i dbang gis rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of the production of agreeable and disagreeable results.

original: dmigs pa'i phyir na rnam par shes pa ni za ba po lta bu ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir na rnam par shes pa ni za ba po lta bu ste /
translated: Consciousness is like the eater, because it is the support of the experience of the results of action.

original: gang du za ba dang / gang za ba dang / gang dang za ba dang / gang dag gis mngon par 'dus byas pa za ba dang / gang zhig za ba po yin pa de yongs su gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du za ba dang / gang za ba dang / gang dang za ba dang / gang dag gis mngon par 'dus byas pa za ba dang / gang zhig za ba po yin pa de yongs su gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The question is then asked: what is the object of the experience? What is the experiencer? What is the experience? What is the cause of the experience? What is the experiencer?

original: yang na khams kyis te /üîΩci zhe na ;üîΩphung po'i go rims so //
analyzed: yang na khams kyis te / ci zhe na ; phung po'i go rims so //
translated: Or else, by reason of the elements.üîΩWhat is the order of the aggregates?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What is the order of the elements?

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The order of the elements is established according to the mode of pre-eminence of the elements.üîΩWhat is the mode of pre-eminence?üîΩThe mode of pre-eminence of the object.

original: yid phyir 'jug pa'i phyir der yul lnga 'dod pa'i yon tan yin te /
analyzed: yid phyir 'jug pa'i phyir der yul lnga 'dod pa'i yon tan yin te /
translated: The mode of pre-eminence of the object is fivefold:

original: kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'dod pas goms par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'dod pas goms par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is cultivated by desire having the characteristic of conceptualized attachment.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan nyid gzugs yin pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi gzugs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan nyid gzugs yin pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi gzugs te /
translated: The form of the sense objects themselves is the form of the sense objects.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi gzugs des mngon par gsal bar byas shing go ba dang rab tu gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi gzugs des mngon par gsal bar byas shing go ba dang rab tu gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: It is manifested, understood, and fully revealed by that form of the sense objects.

original: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni bsam gtan rnams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni bsam gtan rnams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The absorptions are distinguished by feeling.

original: tshor ba tha dad pas de tha dad pa'i @52b phyir te ;
analyzed: tshor ba tha dad pas de tha dad pa'i @52b phyir te ;
translated: They are distinguished by the distinction of feeling.

original: 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan dang po gnyis na ni yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan dang po gnyis na ni yid bde ba'o //
translated: Thus, in the first two absorptions of meditative attainment, there is mental satisfaction.

original: gong ma gnyis na ni bde ba dang btang snyoms dag go //
analyzed: gong ma gnyis na ni bde ba dang btang snyoms dag go //
translated: In the two higher ones, there is pleasure and equanimity.

original: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
analyzed: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
translated: In the absorptions of birth,üîΩthere is mental satisfaction, pleasure, and equanimity.

original: yid bde bde dang btang snyoms dang // btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod //
analyzed: yid bde bde dang btang snyoms dang // btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod //
translated: There is equanimity, mental satisfaction, pleasure, and equanimity.üîΩThere is equanimity.

original: ces pa'o / 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ces pa'o / 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The formless states are distinguished by ideation.

original: de dag na de'i mtshan ma gsal ba'i phyir 'du shes gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: de dag na de'i mtshan ma gsal ba'i phyir 'du shes gtso bo yin te /
translated: In those realms, ideation is primary because the signs of ideation are clear there.

original: btang snyoms thun mong ba yin pa dang rnam par gcad pa med pas na de gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms thun mong ba yin pa dang rnam par gcad pa med pas na de gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: Equanimity is not primary there because it is common to all and is not differentiated.üîΩThe summit of existence is distinguished by mere formation.üîΩThe intention of the summit of existence is the greatest result of all types of intention,

original: 'du byed tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ste zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad pas de'i sems pa 'bras bu che ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'du byed tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ste zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad pas de'i sems pa 'bras bu che ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is said:

original: 'jig rten pa yid dge ba la //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yid dge ba la //
translated: The virtuous mind of the world

original: srid rtse'i sems pa 'bras rab che //üîΩzhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid rtse'i sems pa 'bras rab che // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the intention of the summit of existence, which has the greatest result.üîΩThe summit of existence is distinguished by mere formation because it is the greatest result of all types of intention.

original: gang nas gang zhig shas che ba de nyid der nye bar mtshon par byas so //
analyzed: gang nas gang zhig shas che ba de nyid der nye bar mtshon par byas so //
translated: The formless states are distinguished by ideation because the signs of ideation are clear there.

original: 'di dag ni gang du rnam par shes pa gnas pa yin la zhes bya ba ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba 'dod pa'i khams dang tshor bar nye bar 'gro ba gzugs kyi khams dang / 'du shes su nye bar 'gro ba gzugs med pa gsum dang /
analyzed: 'di dag ni gang du rnam par shes pa gnas pa yin la zhes bya ba ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba 'dod pa'i khams dang tshor bar nye bar 'gro ba gzugs kyi khams dang / 'du shes su nye bar 'gro ba gzugs med pa gsum dang /
translated: These are the abodes of consciousness means that consciousness approaches form in the desire realm, consciousness approaches feeling in the form realm and consciousness approaches discernment in the three formless realms.

original: 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
translated: Consciousness approaches formation in the summit of existence.

original: de dag la rnam par shes pa gnas so zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa de dag la ste /üîΩsrid pa'i rlan gyi mthus so //
analyzed: de dag la rnam par shes pa gnas so zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa de dag la ste / srid pa'i rlan gyi mthus so //
translated: Consciousness abides in those means that consciousness abides in those abodes of consciousness.üîΩBecause of the power of the moisture of existence.

original: phung po'i go rims zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims lta bur bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phung po'i go rims zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims lta bur bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The order of the aggregates is like the order of a field and seeds.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pas bsdus pa phung po bzhi ni zhing lta bu yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pas bsdus pa phung po bzhi ni zhing lta bu yin la /
translated: The four aggregates that are subsumed by the abodes of consciousness are like a field.

original: rnam par shes pa ni sa bon te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni sa bon te /
translated: Consciousness is like a seed.

original: zhing ni sngar yin la /
analyzed: zhing ni sngar yin la /
translated: The field is prior.

original: sa bon ni phyi nas te /
analyzed: sa bon ni phyi nas te /
translated: The seed is later.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: That is why is stated in the Abhidharmakosa:üîΩThe order of the aggregates is like the order of a field and seeds.

original: ji ltar rags pa'i go rims dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go rims ji lta ba bzhin dang / snod la sogs pa don gyi go rims dang / zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims kyi go rims de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rags pa'i go rims dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go rims ji lta ba bzhin dang / snod la sogs pa don gyi go rims dang / zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims kyi go rims de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The order of the aggregates is in accordance with the order of coarseness, the order of defilement, the order of the meaning of vessel, etc., and the order of seed and field.

original: phung po rnams mi mang mi nyung ngo //
analyzed: phung po rnams mi mang mi nyung ngo //
translated: The aggregates are not more or less in number.üîΩAs for the statement, ‚Äúbecause of the order of cause,‚Äù the order of cause is stated in detail:

original: rim rgyu'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir go rims rgyu de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rim rgyu'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir go rims rgyu de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚Äúbecause of the order of cause, that is, because of the order of coarseness, etc.‚Äù

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag gis ches rags pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag gis ches rags pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because these are the coarsest, etc.

original: sems las byung ba thams cad pas @53a * //
analyzed: sems las byung ba thams cad pas @53a * //
translated: Among all the mental factors,üîΩThe order of defilement is the cause.

original: so // kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go rims kyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo dag phan tshun gzugs la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: so // kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go rims kyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo dag phan tshun gzugs la dga' ba ste /
translated: The order of defilement is the cause. Men and women are mutually attracted to each other by their physical forms.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is as stated previously.

original: zas dang tshod ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba dag pas so //
analyzed: zas dang tshod ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba dag pas so //
translated: Like food and drink, they are the basis of the mental factors.

original: de dag gi khams gnyis rab tu phye ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: de dag gi khams gnyis rab tu phye ba zhes bya la /

original: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni gzugs kyi khams so //

original: 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo //

analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /

analyzed: drug gi zhes bya ba smos pa ni de dag gi gnyis ka'i rnam par bzhag pa la go rims kyi rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i smos pa ni phyi'i skye mched dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩyul can gyi rten gyi ngo bos gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / yul can gyi rten gyi ngo bos gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: yul rnam par gzhag pa ni yul can gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The presentation of the object is due to the power of the subject.

original: dbang ni rag las pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ni rag las pa'o //

original: rten par rnam par gzhag pa yang rten gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: rten par rnam par gzhag pa yang rten gyi dbang ngo //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i dbang gis na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

original: skye mched dang khams drug gi dbang nyid kyis de'i yul te /
analyzed: skye mched dang khams drug gi dbang nyid kyis de'i yul te /
translated: The six sense bases and elements are dominant in the sense that they are the objects of the sense faculties.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang ; de'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang ; de'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The objects are form, etc.üîΩThe consciousnesses are the eye consciousness, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi go rims su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi go rims su 'byung ngo //

analyzed: dbang po drug las / dang por lnga ste /
translated: The six sense faculties are listed in the order in which they arise.

original: mig la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag go //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: da ltar byung ba ni chod pa med pas nye ba yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni chod pa med pas nye ba yin te /
translated: Present objects are those that exist in the present.üîΩPresent objects

original: de bas na yul nges pa can yin pa'i phyir de dag gi yul rnams ni sngar smos so //
analyzed: de bas na yul nges pa can yin pa'i phyir de dag gi yul rnams ni sngar smos so //
translated: Therefore, since they have a definite object, they are mentioned first.

analyzed: yid ni yul ma nges pa can yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir mig la sogs pa dag pas phyis smos so zhes ston to //
translated: The mental faculty has an indefinite object, and for that reason it is mentioned last, after the eye faculty, etc.üîΩThe mental faculty has an object that is present for some, up to an object that is not a time for some.

analyzed: yid ni kha cig gi yul ni da ltar ba yin pa nas kha cig dus gsum dang / dus ma yin pa'i bar yin no zhes bya ba la bar smos pa ni 'das pa'i yul can dang / ma 'ongs pa'i yul can dang / da ltar ba'i yul can dang /
translated: The word ‚Äúup to‚Äù includes the mental faculty that has a past object, the mental faculty that has a future object, and the mental faculty that has a present object.

analyzed: dus gsum bsdus pa'i @53b yul can dang / dus ma yin pa'i yul can dang / dus gsum dang dus ma yin pa'i yul can sdud do //
translated: It also includes the mental faculty that has an object that is included in the three times and the mental faculty that has an object that is not a time.

original: de la kha cig ni da ltar ba'i yul can te /
analyzed: de la kha cig ni da ltar ba'i yul can te /
translated: Among these, some have a present object.

original: dper na gzhan gyi sems shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhan gyi sems shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: kha cig ni 'das pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'das pa'i yul can te /

original: dper na sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: For example, the knowledge that recollects past lives.

original: kha cig ni ma 'ongs pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: kha cig ni ma 'ongs pa'i yul can te /
translated: Some are related to future objects,

original: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa'am /
translated: for example, the cognition of what is desired,

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa bzhin no //
translated: or the cognition of death and birth.

original: kha cig ni dus gsum gyi yul can te /
analyzed: kha cig ni dus gsum gyi yul can te /

analyzed: dper na chos thams cad mi rtag go snyam pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the thought that all things are impermanent.

original: kha cig ni dus med pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: kha cig ni dus med pa'i yul can te /
translated: Some are related to objects that are not in time,

original: dper na 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhin no //

original: kha cig ni dus gsum dang dus ma yin pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: kha cig ni dus gsum dang dus ma yin pa'i yul can te /

analyzed: dper na chos thams cad bdag med do snyam pa lta bu ste /
translated: for example, the thought that all things are without self.

original: de'i phyir yid ni ma nges pas phyis bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid ni ma nges pas phyis bshad do //

analyzed: lus kyi yul ni ma nges te //üîΩzhes bya ba la /

original: res 'ga' ni 'byung ba dag yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni 'byung ba dag yin te /
