analyzed: gang gi tshe sra ba nyid la sogs pa la reg pa na'o // res 'ga' ni 'byung ba las gyur pa dag yin pa ni gang gi tshe 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa na reg pa na'o // res 'ga' gnyi ga yin no zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dag dang 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
translated: when one touches solidity, etc.üîΩSometimes they are derivative form, when one touches smoothness, etc.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa sna tshogs pa la dmigs pa skye ba na'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa sna tshogs pa la dmigs pa skye ba na'o //
translated: Sometimes they are both, when the various body consciousnesses arise that have both primary elements and derivative form as their objects.

original: de'i phyir yul nges pa can ni sngar yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul nges pa can ni sngar yin la /
translated: Therefore, the first two are determined with respect to their objects,

original: yul ma nges pa can ni phyi nas so //
analyzed: yul ma nges pa can ni phyi nas so //
translated: and the latter two are not determined with respect to their objects.

original: lhag ma ci rigs par zhes bya ba la /üîΩci rigs par mig la sogs pa gnyis ni gnyis dang gcig ni gsum dang / gcig ni gcig pas sngar smos te /üîΩmig dang rna ba ni yul rgyang ring ba'i phyir gnyis pas de dag sngar smos so //
analyzed: lhag ma ci rigs par zhes bya ba la / ci rigs par mig la sogs pa gnyis ni gnyis dang gcig ni gsum dang / gcig ni gcig pas sngar smos te / mig dang rna ba ni yul rgyang ring ba'i phyir gnyis pas de dag sngar smos so //
translated: The remaining faculties are as is fitting.üîΩAs is fitting, the first two faculties, the eyes and ears, are mentioned first because they are two and because they are distant from their objects.

original: de gnyis las kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyis las kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among those two, the eyes are mentioned first because they are more excellent than the ears.

original: mig dang / rna ba gnyis las kyang mig ni ches ring po la 'jug ste /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba gnyis las kyang mig ni ches ring po la 'jug ste /
translated: The eye and ear are also mentioned in order, but the eye is mentioned first because it engages objects at a greater distance.

original: de'i phyir gnyis 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gsum pas kyang sngar smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gsum pas kyang sngar smos so //
translated: Therefore, not only are the two mentioned in order, but the nose is mentioned first because it engages objects at a greater distance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chu klung rgyang ring po nas mthong yang de'i sgra mi thos pas @54a * //üîΩzhes smras so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chu klung rgyang ring po nas mthong yang de'i sgra mi thos pas @54a * // zhes smras so //
translated: For that reason, when one sees a river from a distance, one does not hear its sound.

original: sna ni cher myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir gcig pas sngar smos te /
analyzed: sna ni cher myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir gcig pas sngar smos te /
translated: Therefore the nose is mentioned first because it engages objects more quickly.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: zas lce dang ma phrad pa nyid kyi dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zas lce dang ma phrad pa nyid kyi dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because it apprehends the smell of food that has not yet come into contact with the tongue.

original: gal te ma phrad pa'i zas kyi gong bu la brten pa'i dri kho na snas 'dzin na /
analyzed: gal te ma phrad pa'i zas kyi gong bu la brten pa'i dri kho na snas 'dzin na /
translated: If the nose only apprehends the smell that is based in the unmixed mass of food,

original: sna phrad nas 'dzin pa nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sna phrad nas 'dzin pa nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would contradict that the nose apprehends through contact.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: zas dang 'dres pa'i rdzis myur du sna'i yul du phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: zas dang 'dres pa'i rdzis myur du sna'i yul du phyin pa yin te /
translated: The smell mixed with food quickly becomes the object of the nose.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ni rdzi la brten pa'i dri la zas kyi dri zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ni rdzi la brten pa'i dri la zas kyi dri zhes bya'o //
translated: The odor of food is so called because it is similar to that odor which is based on the nose.

original: yang na ji ltar gnas pa'i rim zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar gnas pa'i rim zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or else, the order is in accordance with the order in which they are located.

original: gsum ni phreng ba ltar gnas kyang /
analyzed: gsum ni phreng ba ltar gnas kyang /
translated: Although the three are located like a garland,

original: gang dang gang gi dbang po'i rten dang po na gnas pa de dang de sngar smos te /
analyzed: gang dang gang gi dbang po'i rten dang po na gnas pa de dang de sngar smos te /
translated: each one is mentioned first in accordance with the order in which its basis is located.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: mig gi rten ni dang po na gnas so zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: mig gi rten ni dang po na gnas so zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
translated: the basis of the eye is located first, etc.

original: lus kyi rten ni lce'i dbang po'i rten de'i 'og na gnas so //
analyzed: lus kyi rten ni lce'i dbang po'i rten de'i 'og na gnas so //
translated: The basis of the body is located below the basis of the tongue sense faculty.

original: lus thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po gang na yang gnas mod kyi /
analyzed: lus thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po gang na yang gnas mod kyi /
translated: The body sense faculty is located everywhere on the body,

original: 'og na ni ches mang ngo //
analyzed: 'og na ni ches mang ngo //
translated: but it is most abundant below.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: phal cher zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said to be ‚Äúmostly.‚Äù

original: de'i gong na mi gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i gong na mi gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is not located above that.

original: yid kyi dbang po'i go ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po'i go ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What about the mental faculty?

original: de'i phyir / yid ni de dag la brten pa dang / yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / yid ni de dag la brten pa dang / yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbecause the mind is supported by those and does not abide in the object field.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i mtshan nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i mtshan nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The five collections of consciousness have the characteristic of the five sense faculties, and the mind consciousness has the characteristic of the mental faculty.

original: 'di dag rnam pa drug car yang gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'di dag rnam pa drug car yang gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas so //
translated: Since all six of these are not physical, they do not abide in the object field.

original: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //üîΩdbang don de dag kho na la //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo // dbang don de dag kho na la //
translated: Why is that?üîΩThe ten bases and ten elements

original: skye mched dang ni khams bcur 'dod //
analyzed: skye mched dang ni khams bcur 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be just those sense faculties and objects.

original: ces bya ba der gzugs can gyi skye mched bcu gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du bshad la /
analyzed: ces bya ba der gzugs can gyi skye mched bcu gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du bshad la /
translated: In that passage, the ten physical bases are explained to be the nature of the form aggregate.

original: chos rnams rab tu rnam 'byed med par zhes bya ba der skye mched thams cad chos kyi rang bzhin du bshad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams rab tu rnam 'byed med par zhes bya ba der skye mched thams cad chos kyi rang bzhin du bshad pa de'i phyir /
translated: In the passage, ‚ÄúWithout the discernment of phenomena,‚Äù all the bases are explained to be the nature of the phenomena element.

original: bye brag don dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bye brag don dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThe specific purpose is to explain the aggregates, bases, and elements.‚Äù

original: gal te gzugs kyi bdag nyid du khyad par med kyang gcig ni gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya bar brjod kyi /üîΩgzhan dag ma yin /
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi bdag nyid du khyad par med kyang gcig ni gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya bar brjod kyi / gzhan dag ma yin /
translated: If you say that form is not differentiated as to its intrinsic reality, then why is one called the form base and not the others?

original: yang na sgra la sogs pa'i skye mched ltar 'di la yang ming gzhan ci'i phyir mi brjod do /
analyzed: yang na sgra la sogs pa'i skye mched ltar 'di la yang ming gzhan ci'i phyir mi brjod do /
translated: Or, like the sound base, etc., why is it not called by another name?

original: 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the reason for this?

original: de bzhin du @54b chos kyi skye mched la yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du @54b chos kyi skye mched la yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: The same should be said of the dharma base.

original: bshad pa / bye brag ni gzugs kyi chos nyid du khyad par med pa rnams so sor skye mched nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / bye brag ni gzugs kyi chos nyid du khyad par med pa rnams so sor skye mched nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The author replies: The differentiation is in order to make known that the undifferentiated intrinsic natures of form are each a base.

original: bye brag de yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: bye brag de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is that differentiation?

original: ming ngo // gal te gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bcu char la yang gzugs kyi skye mched ces brjod na ni ming la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams so sor yul dang yul can gyi dngos por rtogs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ming ngo // gal te gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bcu char la yang gzugs kyi skye mched ces brjod na ni ming la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams so sor yul dang yul can gyi dngos por rtogs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Name. If the ten were called the form base because they have the nature of form, then name, etc., and form, etc., would not be understood as the objects and subjects of cognition.

original: de ma rtogs pas kyang de dag so sor skye mched nyid du shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma rtogs pas kyang de dag so sor skye mched nyid du shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and because they are not understood, they are not known individually as the sense bases.

original: de'i phyir skye mched gsum du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched gsum du 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, there are three sense bases.

original: / de'i don du gzugs kyi bdag nyid can du khyad par med kyang gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du brjod na /
analyzed: / de'i don du gzugs kyi bdag nyid can du khyad par med kyang gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du brjod na /
translated: Even though there is no difference in their nature as form, one is called the form sense base,

original: sgra la sogs pa rnams ming gzhan dag gi skye mched du rnam par gzhag par brjod do //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa rnams ming gzhan dag gi skye mched du rnam par gzhag par brjod do //
translated: and sound, etc., are called the other sense bases.

original: gzugs la yang skye mched gzhan rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ming gzhan mi 'dogs te ;
analyzed: gzugs la yang skye mched gzhan rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ming gzhan mi 'dogs te ;
translated: Form is not given another name in order to distinguish it from the other sense bases,

original: de ni byed rgyu ltar gzugs kyi ming thun mong pa kho nas gzhan dag las rnam par gcod pas khyad par gyi ming gdags pa don med do //
analyzed: de ni byed rgyu ltar gzugs kyi ming thun mong pa kho nas gzhan dag las rnam par gcod pas khyad par gyi ming gdags pa don med do //
translated: because it is distinguished from the others by the common name form alone, like the word cause. Therefore, it is meaningless to give it a distinguishing name.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: mig la sogs pa bye brag tu byas pa dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bye brag tu byas pa dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause the eye, etc., are distinguished,‚Äù and so on.

original: mtshan ma ma btab pa'i ba lang bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma btab pa'i ba lang bzhin no //
translated: like an unmarked cow.

original: yang na gzugs kyi skye mched kho na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ming thun mong ston par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: yang na gzugs kyi skye mched kho na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ming thun mong ston par mdzad kyi /
translated: Or else, form is the principal object, so the name form is used to indicate the commonality of all form.

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid yin yang gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid yin yang gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Although it is the nature of form, it is not the other sense bases,

original: gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not principal.

original: gzhan dag pas gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag pas gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that form is principal,

original: de ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúBecause it is impeded.‚Äù

original: gal te reg bya ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched la lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis ci ltar reg ce na /
analyzed: gal te reg bya ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched la lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis ci ltar reg ce na /
translated: If it is not tangible, how can the form base be touched by the contact of hands, etc.?

original: de nyid la reg par ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid la reg par ni mi brjod do //
translated: It is not said that it is touched.

original: 'on kyang de'i rten 'byung ba rnams lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnam par 'gyur ba las gzugs su rung ba na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rten 'byung ba rnams lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnam par 'gyur ba las gzugs su rung ba na /
translated: However, when the elements that are its support are touched by the contact of hands, etc., form becomes transformed.

original: de yang gzugs su rung bas reg na gzugs su rung ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de yang gzugs su rung bas reg na gzugs su rung ba zhes brjod de /
translated: When that is touched, it is said that form is touched.

original: rang gi rten dang / grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rten dang / grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the same support, the same production, and the same cessation.üîΩMoreover, because it is resistant, it is touched by the contact of hands, etc.

original: yang de yang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'dus te reg pa dag gis te /üîΩ@55a * // 'brel ba dag gis reg na ste /
analyzed: yang de yang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'dus te reg pa dag gis te / @55a * // 'brel ba dag gis reg na ste /
translated: It is touched by contact, i.e., by the contact of hands, etc.

original: phrad na gzugs su rung zhing gzhom du rung ngo //üîΩ'di ni 'di na'o zhes bya ba ni yul nye bar brtag tu rung ba las so //
analyzed: phrad na gzugs su rung zhing gzhom du rung ngo // 'di ni 'di na'o zhes bya ba ni yul nye bar brtag tu rung ba las so //
translated: It is susceptible to being put together, i.e., it is susceptible to being destroyed.üîΩIt is susceptible to being apprehended as here or there, i.e., as being in a certain place, as being near or far.

original: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bya ba ni yul thag ring ba brtag tu rung ba las so //
analyzed: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bya ba ni yul thag ring ba brtag tu rung ba las so //
translated: It is susceptible to being apprehended as here or there, i.e., as being in a certain place, as being near or far.

original: de'i phyir de lta na gzugs su rung ba'i phyir dang / brtag tu rung ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched kho na gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na gzugs su rung ba'i phyir dang / brtag tu rung ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched kho na gtso bo yin no //
translated: Thus, because it is susceptible to being put together and susceptible to being apprehended, the visible form sense-sphere is the most important.

original: gzhan dag la ni brtag tu rung ba med pa'i phyir gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni brtag tu rung ba med pa'i phyir gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: The other sense-spheres are not the most important because they are not susceptible to being apprehended.

original: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa rnams ni rdzas su dpag pas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa rnams ni rdzas su dpag pas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di na'o //
translated: The eye sense-faculty, etc., are susceptible to being apprehended by inference because they are substances.

original: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes dngos su brtag tu mi rung la /
analyzed: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes dngos su brtag tu mi rung la /
translated: It is not possible to say that it is located here or there.

original: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched dag ni phrad nas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir che ge mo zhig na'o zhes yongs su brtag par mi nus so //
analyzed: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i skye mched dag ni phrad nas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir che ge mo zhig na'o zhes yongs su brtag par mi nus so //
translated: The sense-spheres of smell, taste and tactility are to be grasped by contact. Therefore, it is not possible to say that they are located here or there.

original: sgra'i skye mched la yang phyogs bstan pa brtag tu yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: sgra'i skye mched la yang phyogs bstan pa brtag tu yod par zad kyi /
translated: As for the sense-sphere of sound, it is possible to indicate its direction, but not its location.

original: yul brtag pa ni med do //
analyzed: yul brtag pa ni med do //
translated: Sound is not located in a place.

original: 'jig rten na yang gzugs so zhes grags so /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang gzugs so zhes grags so /
translated: In the world, it is said that sound is form,

original: sgra la sogs pa gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that the others, such as sound, are form.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa yang 'jig rten la bstan par bya ba'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa yang 'jig rten la bstan par bya ba'i phyir yin te /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma by the Lord is also for the sake of teaching the world.

original: bye brag la sogs pa bstan bcos rig pa rnams kyis kyang sgra la sogs pa rnams gzugs nyid du ma gtogs so //üîΩbye brag gi don nyid kyis gcig ni chos kyi skye mched du bshad kyi /
analyzed: bye brag la sogs pa bstan bcos rig pa rnams kyis kyang sgra la sogs pa rnams gzugs nyid du ma gtogs so // bye brag gi don nyid kyis gcig ni chos kyi skye mched du bshad kyi /
translated: The treatises on logic, etc., also teach that sound, etc., are not included in form.

original: thams cad ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: One is explained as the sense-sphere of mental objects because of the meaning of particularity, but not all.üîΩWhat is the meaning of particularity?

original: ci nas kyang yul dang yul can nyid du zhes bya ba rgya cher sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci nas kyang yul dang yul can nyid du zhes bya ba rgya cher sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase in the sense of object and subject should be supplied to each of the above phrases.

original: mig la sogs pa bye brag tu byas pa dag gis spyi ming btags kyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bye brag tu byas pa dag gis spyi ming btags kyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: The general term is applied to the eye, etc., which are distinguished from one another, but not to anything else.

original: chos mang ba dang zhes bya ba la ;üîΩ'dir chos kyi ming can gyi chos mang po rnams kho na 'dus te /
analyzed: chos mang ba dang zhes bya ba la ; 'dir chos kyi ming can gyi chos mang po rnams kho na 'dus te /
translated: The phrase many things refers toüîΩthe aggregates of feeling, perception, disposition, and consciousness.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shes pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / dad pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / skyabs dang / dkon mchog la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shes pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / dad pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / skyabs dang / dkon mchog la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Here, the many things that are called dharmas are included in the aggregate of form, the aggregate of dharma-s, the branches of enlightenment, the knowledges, the recollections, faith, the establishments of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of the path, the branches of the trance-states, the pure factors, the unconditioned factors, and the unmanifest form.

original: 'dir tshor ba la sogs pa chos mang po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir tshor ba la sogs pa chos mang po zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase many things refers to the aggregates of feeling, etc.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bsdus te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bsdus te /
translated: Here, the aggregates of feeling, perception, disposition, and consciousness are included in the aggregate of dharma-s, the branches of enlightenment, the knowledges, the recollections, faith, the establishments of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of the path, the branches of the trance-states, the pure factors, the unconditioned factors, and the unmanifest form.

original: chos kyi sgra spyi ming med par de dag ji ltar 'dzin par @55b 'gyur ;
analyzed: chos kyi sgra spyi ming med par de dag ji ltar 'dzin par @55b 'gyur ;
translated: How could they apprehend those phenomena without a general term for phenomena?

original: de'i phyir spyi ming brjod pas chos mang po bsdus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi ming brjod pas chos mang po bsdus te /
translated: Therefore, the term for the general class is stated in order to include many phenomena,

original: 'du byed kyi phung po bzhin zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po bzhin zhes ston to //
translated: like the aggregate of formation.

original: chos kyi mchog ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa ni mchog nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi mchog ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / mya ngan las 'das pa ni mchog nyid de /
translated: The supreme phenomena are explained in detail.

original: dge ba dang rtag pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dge ba dang rtag pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Nirvana is supreme because it is virtuous and permanent,üîΩor because it is the pacification of suffering and its cause.

original: zad par gyi skye mched bcu las /
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched bcu las /
translated: The ten all-encompassing bases are included in the five aggregates.

original: zad par nam mkha' dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dag dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi po dag gis te /
analyzed: zad par nam mkha' dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dag dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi po dag gis te /
translated: The four formless states are the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dag ni rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dag ni rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor nonperception are by nature the four aggregates because they are formless states that are concomitant with the four aggregates.

original: yid dang / chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: yid dang / chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
translated: They are included in the mental faculty and the phenomena element.

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The five bases of liberation

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched dang po gsum la ni gzhung 'dzin pas sgra'i skye mched yod do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched dang po gsum la ni gzhung 'dzin pas sgra'i skye mched yod do //
translated: The first three bases of liberation have the sound base because the Abhidharma masters assert that sound exists there.

original: bzhi pa la yang gal te brjod cing brjod nas sems par byed na ni skye mched gsum yod la /
analyzed: bzhi pa la yang gal te brjod cing brjod nas sems par byed na ni skye mched gsum yod la /
translated: The fourth base of liberation has three bases if one speaks and then reflects,

original: de lta ma yin na yid dang / chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yid dang / chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
translated: but if one does not speak, it is included in the mental faculty and the phenomena element.

original: lnga pa la yang yid dang / chos kyi skye mched dag yod de /
analyzed: lnga pa la yang yid dang / chos kyi skye mched dag yod de /
translated: The fifth has both the mental faculty and the phenomena element.

original: de'i phyir 'khor dang bcas pa rnams sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor dang bcas pa rnams sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, the retinue is included in the sound, mental faculty and phenomena elements.

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga gang zhe na /üîΩmdo las / 'di la dge slong la ston pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga gang zhe na / mdo las / 'di la dge slong la ston pa'am /
translated: What are the five bases of liberation?üîΩA sutra states:

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa bla ma lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig gis chos ston par byed na /üîΩ'di la ston pa 'am mkhas pa bla ma'i sa lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig ji lta ji ltar chos ston par byed pa de lta de ltar chos de dag la /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa bla ma lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig gis chos ston par byed na / 'di la ston pa 'am mkhas pa bla ma'i sa lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig ji lta ji ltar chos ston par byed pa de lta de ltar chos de dag la /
translated: Here, a monk is taught Dharma by the Teacher or by a virtuous friend who is a fellow practitioner and is like a guru.

original: @57b don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @57b don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: In whatever way the Teacher or a virtuous friend who is like a guru teaches Dharma, to that extent the monk generates the discernment of the meaning and the discernment of phenomena with regard to those Dharmas.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang chos so so yang dag par rig pa de la rab tu dga' ba skyed do //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang chos so so yang dag par rig pa de la rab tu dga' ba skyed do //
translated: He generates joy in the discernment of the meaning and the discernment of phenomena.

original: rab tu dga' bar gyur ba la dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar gyur ba la dga' ba skye'o //
translated: Joy arises in one who is very pleased.

original: yid dga' bar 'gyur ba'i lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: yid dga' bar 'gyur ba'i lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro ;
translated: The body of one whose mind is joyful becomes pliant.

original: / lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has a pliant body experiences bliss.

original: bde bar gyur na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: bde bar gyur na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: When one is blissful, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag na ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing /üîΩyang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag na ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is concentrated, one knows and sees things as they really are.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba na yid byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba na yid byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one knows and sees things as they really are, one becomes disgusted.

original: yid byung ba na 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid byung ba na 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is disgusted, one becomes detached.

original: 'dod chags dang bral na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is detached, one is liberated.

original: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched dang po'o //
translated: This is the first stage of liberation.

original: de bzhin du kha don byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha don byed /
translated: In the same way, one should recite the scriptures to oneself,

original: gzhan dag la yang ston par byed /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang ston par byed /
translated: teach them to others,

original: sems par byed ;
analyzed: sems par byed ;
translated: and reflect on them.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan bzang po legs par 'dzin par 'gyur zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan bzang po legs par 'dzin par 'gyur zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: It is the cause of the good signs of meditative concentration.

original: rnam par grol ba ni mi slob pa'i mos pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni mi slob pa'i mos pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the faith of the adept.

original: de la gegs byed pa ni nyon mongs pa dag ste /
analyzed: de la gegs byed pa ni nyon mongs pa dag ste /
translated: The afflictions are the obstacles to that.

original: de dag ni shes rab kyi mtshon gyis gcod par byed pa la /
analyzed: de dag ni shes rab kyi mtshon gyis gcod par byed pa la /
translated: They are cut off by the sword of wisdom.

original: de bcad pas rnam par grol ba skye bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de bcad pas rnam par grol ba skye bar 'gyur te ;
translated: Liberation arises from their being cut off.

original: de'i phyir shes rab ni rnam par grol ba skye ba'i sgor gyur pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab ni rnam par grol ba skye ba'i sgor gyur pas na /
translated: Therefore, wisdom is the door to the arising of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched ni shes rab yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched ni shes rab yin no //
translated: The sense base of liberation is wisdom.

original: sgra ni de dag gi sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: sgra ni de dag gi sbyor ba yin la /
translated: Sound is the application of that.

original: shes rab ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: Wisdom is the actual practice.

original: skye mched gnyis las zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched gnyis las te /
analyzed: skye mched gnyis las zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched gnyis las te /
translated: From two sense bases means from the two sense bases of the beings without conception and the sense base of neither conception nor non-conception.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: kun dga' bo skye mched ni gnyis te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo skye mched ni gnyis te /
translated: Ananda, there are two sense bases.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the base of the sentient beings without ideation, and the base of neither ideation nor non-ideation.

original: skye mched gnyis po de dag las 'du shes med pa'i sems can ni skye mched bcus bsdus te /
analyzed: skye mched gnyis po de dag las 'du shes med pa'i sems can ni skye mched bcus bsdus te /
translated: The sentient beings without ideation are included in ten bases,

original: gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i phyir de na dri dang ro med pa'i phyir dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i dus dag na yid kyi skye mched yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i phyir de na dri dang ro med pa'i phyir dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i dus dag na yid kyi skye mched yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they belong to the realm of form, and because odor and taste are absent there, and because the base of the mental faculty exists at the time of death and rebirth.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who proceed to the base of neither ideation nor non-ideation are included in the base of the mental faculty and the entity base.

original: der @58a * //
analyzed: der @58a * //
translated: There,

original: tshor pa la sogs pa phung po gsum ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus la /
analyzed: tshor pa la sogs pa phung po gsum ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus la /
translated: the three aggregates of feeling, etc. are included in the entity base.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni yid kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni yid kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is included in the base of the mental faculty.

original: de bzhin du khams mang po las khams drug cu rtsa gnyis bstan pa de dag kyang ci rigs par bsdu bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de bzhin du khams mang po las khams drug cu rtsa gnyis bstan pa de dag kyang ci rigs par bsdu bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la ;
translated: So too, the sixty-two elements should be understood to be included in the eighteen elements as appropriate.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How are they included?

original: khams ni bco brgyad de /
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad de /
translated: There are eighteen elements:

original: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: the eye element, form element, eye consciousness element, and so on.

original: de la sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang ; rnam par shes pa'i khams de dag gis bsdu ba ni phyi nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang ; rnam par shes pa'i khams de dag gis bsdu ba ni phyi nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, space element and consciousness element are included in the eighteen elements as explained below.

original: yang khams drug ste /
analyzed: yang khams drug ste /
translated: There are six elements:

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gnod sems kyi khams dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams dang / nges par 'byung ba'i khams dang / gnod sems med pa'i khams dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gnod sems kyi khams dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams dang / nges par 'byung ba'i khams dang / gnod sems med pa'i khams dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams te /
translated: the desire element, malice element, harm element, renunciation element, non-malice element, and non-harm element.

original: 'di dag ni chos kyi khams su 'du'o //üîΩde la 'dod pa'i khams kyi sgras ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la mngon par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni chos kyi khams su 'du'o // de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi sgras ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la mngon par 'dod kyi /
translated: These are included in the element of mental objects.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni ma yin te /
translated: The element of desire refers to the desire for sexual intercourse, not to the realm of desire.

original: gzhan du na de'i khongs su 'du bas gnod sems kyi khams dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams logs shig tu ni brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de'i khongs su 'du bas gnod sems kyi khams dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams logs shig tu ni brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the element of malice and the element of violence would be mentioned separately, since they are included in the realm of desire.

original: yang khams drug ste /
analyzed: yang khams drug ste /
translated: There are six other elements:

original: sdug bsngal gyi khams dang / bde ba'i khams dang / yid mi bde ba'i khams dang / yid bde ba'i khams dang / btang snyoms kyi khams dang / ma rig pa'i khams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi khams dang / bde ba'i khams dang / yid mi bde ba'i khams dang / yid bde ba'i khams dang / btang snyoms kyi khams dang / ma rig pa'i khams so //
translated: the element of suffering, the element of pleasure, the element of mental satisfaction, the element of mental dissatisfaction, the element of indifference, and the element of ignorance.

original: 'di dag kyang chos kyi khams su 'du'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang chos kyi khams su 'du'o //
translated: These are also included in the element of mental objects.

original: yang khams bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang khams bzhi ste /
translated: There are four other elements:

original: tshor ba'i khams dang / 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i khams dang / 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams te /
translated: the element of sensation, the element of conception, the element of the formative forces, and the element of consciousness.

original: gsum ni chos kyi khams su 'du la /
analyzed: gsum ni chos kyi khams su 'du la /
translated: Three of these are included in the element of mental objects.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug tu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug tu'o //
translated: The element of consciousness is the six elements of consciousness.

original: yang khams gsum ste /
analyzed: yang khams gsum ste /
translated: There are also three other elements:

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te /
translated: the element of desire, the element of form, and the element of formlessness.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni khams btso brgyad dag tu 'du'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni khams btso brgyad dag tu 'du'o //
translated: The element of desire is included in the eighteen elements.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni khams bcu bzhir 'du'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni khams bcu bzhir 'du'o //
translated: The element of form is included in the fourteen elements.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / chos kyi khams dag tu 'du'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / chos kyi khams dag tu 'du'o //
translated: The element of formlessness is included in the mental faculty, the element of mental consciousness, and the element of factors.

original: yang khams gsum ste /
analyzed: yang khams gsum ste /
translated: There are also three other elements:

original: @58b gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams so //
analyzed: @58b gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams so //
translated: the element of form, the element of formlessness, and the element of cessation.

original: gnyis kyis bsdu ba ni smras zin to //
analyzed: gnyis kyis bsdu ba ni smras zin to //
translated: The inclusion in two elements has already been explained.

original: 'gog pa'i khams ni chos kyi khams su 'du'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i khams ni chos kyi khams su 'du'o //
translated: The element of cessation is included in the element of factors.

original: yang khams gsum ste /
analyzed: yang khams gsum ste /
translated: There are also three other elements:

original: 'das pa'i khams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i khams dang / da ltar byung ba'i khams te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i khams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i khams dang / da ltar byung ba'i khams te /
translated: the past element, the future element, and the present element.

original: 'di dag ni re re zhing khams bco brgyad dag tu 'du'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni re re zhing khams bco brgyad dag tu 'du'o //
translated: Each of these is included in the eighteen elements.

original: yang khams gsum ste /
analyzed: yang khams gsum ste /
translated: There are also three other elements:

original: dman pa'i khams dang / gya nom pa'i khams dang / bar ma'i khams te /
analyzed: dman pa'i khams dang / gya nom pa'i khams dang / bar ma'i khams te /
translated: the inferior realm, the excellent realm, and the middling realm.

original: gsum po 'di dag kyang ci rigs bar khams bco brgyad dag tu 'du'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag kyang ci rigs bar khams bco brgyad dag tu 'du'o //
translated: These three realms are included in the eighteen realms as appropriate.

original: yang khams gzhan gsum ste /
analyzed: yang khams gzhan gsum ste /
translated: There are also three other realms:

original: dge ba'i khams dang / mi dge ba'i khams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i khams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i khams dang / mi dge ba'i khams dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i khams so //
translated: the wholesome realm, the unwholesome realm, and the undefined realm.

original: dang po gnyis ni gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / chos kyi khams su 'du'o //
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / chos kyi khams su 'du'o //
translated: The first two are included in the form realm, the sound realm, the mental realm, the six consciousness realms, and the entity realm.

original: gsum pa ni bco brgyad char du 'du'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni bco brgyad char du 'du'o //
translated: The third is included in all eighteen.

original: yang khams gsum ste /
analyzed: yang khams gsum ste /
translated: There are also three other realms:

original: slob pa'i khams dang / mi slob pa'i khams dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i khams so //
analyzed: slob pa'i khams dang / mi slob pa'i khams dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i khams so //
translated: the realm of the learner, the realm of the non-learner, and the realm of neither the learner nor the non-learner.

original: de la slob pa dang mi slob pa'i khams gnyis ni yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams su 'du'o //
analyzed: de la slob pa dang mi slob pa'i khams gnyis ni yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams su 'du'o //
translated: Among them, the two realms of the learner and the non-learner are included in the mental realm, the entity realm, and the mental consciousness realm.

original: gsum pa ni bco brgyad du yang 'du'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni bco brgyad du yang 'du'o //
translated: The third is included in all eighteen.

original: yang khams gnyis te /
analyzed: yang khams gnyis te /
translated: There are two other elements:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams dang / zag pa med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams dang / zag pa med pa'i khams te /
translated: the element with outflows and the element without outflows.

original: dang po ni bco brgyad du 'du'o //
analyzed: dang po ni bco brgyad du 'du'o //
translated: The first is included in the eighteen elements.

original: gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni /
translated: The second is included in the mental faculty,

original: yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag tu'o //
analyzed: yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag tu'o //
translated: the entity element, and the mental consciousness element.

original: yang khams gnyis te /
analyzed: yang khams gnyis te /
translated: There are two other elements:

original: 'dus byas kyi khams dang ; 'dus ma byas kyi khams so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams dang ; 'dus ma byas kyi khams so //
translated: the conditioned element and the unconditioned element.

original: dang po ni bco brgyad dag tu 'dul /
analyzed: dang po ni bco brgyad dag tu 'dul /
translated: The first is included in the eighteen elements.

original: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams su 'du'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams su 'du'o //
translated: The second is included in the entity element.

original: de'i phyir khams bco brgyad po de dag ni drug tshan gsum dang / bzhi tshan gcig dang / gsum tshan drug dang / gnyis tshan gnyis dang / drug cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i phyir khams bco brgyad po de dag ni drug tshan gsum dang / bzhi tshan gcig dang / gsum tshan drug dang / gnyis tshan gnyis dang / drug cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, these eighteen elements are three groups of six, one group of four, six groups of three, two groups of two, and sixty-two individual elements.

original: de ltar na khams bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi po de dag ni khams bco brgyad po de dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na khams bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi po de dag ni khams bco brgyad po de dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, these forty-four elements are included in the eighteen elements.

original: der gang dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: der gang dag ces bya ba la /
translated: In that regard, what are the four?

original: der zhes bya ba ni khams mang po pa'i mdor ro //

analyzed: gzugs can smos pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word form is mentioned in order to exclude the formless.

original: chos kyi skye mched la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pas gzugs can du tha snyad gdags su yod pas bcu zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pas gzugs can du tha snyad gdags su yod pas bcu zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The term ‚Äúten‚Äù is stated because the form base is conventionally designated as form since imperceptible form exists in the form base.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa las kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa las kyang /
translated: Therefore the Autocommentary states:

original: bcu gang dag ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: bcu gang dag ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: What are the ten?

original: de dag la gzugs su rung ba yod pas na gzugs can no //
analyzed: de dag la gzugs su rung ba yod pas na gzugs can no //
translated: They are called ‚Äúhaving form‚Äù because they can be transformed into form.

original: thogs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /üîΩthogs pa zhes bya ba ni brdugs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: thogs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na / thogs pa zhes bya ba ni brdugs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: What is this called obstruction?üîΩObstruction is resistance.

original: de dag la yod pas na thogs ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la yod pas na thogs ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: They are called ‚Äúhaving obstruction‚Äù because they exist there.

original: nor dang bcas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nor dang bcas pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like those who have wealth.

original: de la rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Obstruction is of three types.

original: thogs pa'i sgra thams cad du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa'i sgra thams cad du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term obstruction is used in many ways.

original: de la sgrib pa la thogs pa ni rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba'i gegs byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa la thogs pa ni rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba'i gegs byed pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among them, obstruction to matter is the prevention of the arising of another in its own place.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na lag pa 'am rdo ba la lag pa brdugs shing thogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na lag pa 'am rdo ba la lag pa brdugs shing thogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, the hand is obstructed by the hand and the stone is obstructed by the stone.

original: lag pa'i yul du lag pa gzhan mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrdo ba la yang lag pa brdugs te /
analyzed: lag pa'i yul du lag pa gzhan mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to // rdo ba la yang lag pa brdugs te /
translated: The hand does not arise in the place occupied by the hand.

original: de'i yul du mi skye ba'i phyir de la thogs so //
analyzed: de'i yul du mi skye ba'i phyir de la thogs so //
translated: The stone is obstructed by the hand because it does not arise in the place occupied by the hand.

original: rdo ba yang de gnyis la zhes bya ba ni lag pa dang rdo ba gnyis la ste /
analyzed: rdo ba yang de gnyis la zhes bya ba ni lag pa dang rdo ba gnyis la ste /
translated: The hand and the stone are obstructed by the two, the hand and the stone,

original: de'i yul du mi skye ba'i phyir thogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yul du mi skye ba'i phyir thogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because they do not arise in the place occupied by the two.

original: yul la thogs pa ni mig la sogs pa yul can rnams rang gi yul dag la ste /
analyzed: yul la thogs pa ni mig la sogs pa yul can rnams rang gi yul dag la ste /
translated: Obstruction by object refers to the eye and so on, which are subjects, in regard to their objects.

original: yul la sogs pa ni phrad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa ni phrad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the object and so on are contact,

original: btags pa las ji skad du zhes bya ba drangs so //
analyzed: btags pa las ji skad du zhes bya ba drangs so //
translated: the root text cites the Abhidharma

original: btags pa'i bstan bcos las chu la thogs la zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul chu la thogs pa ste /
analyzed: btags pa'i bstan bcos las chu la thogs la zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul chu la thogs pa ste /
translated: The Abhidharma states that water is obstructed by water because it is obstructed by water in its own place.

original: yul chu dang phrad ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: yul chu dang phrad ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that it contacts water, its object.

original: skam la ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: skam la ni ma yin no ;
translated: It is not obstructed by dry land.

original: / nya pa la sogs pa kha cig gi chu la thogs pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: / nya pa la sogs pa kha cig gi chu la thogs pas de'i phyir /
translated: Some, such as fishermen, are obstructed by water.

original: mi phal che'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi phal che'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúlike the majority of humans.‚Äù

original: gnyis kar thogs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gnyis kar thogs pa yang yod de /
translated: There are also those who are obstructed by both.

original: chu srin byis pa gsod la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu srin byis pa gsod la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: They are like the porpoise, the child-killer, etc.

original: gnyis kar ma yin pa'i yang yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gnyis kar ma yin pa'i yang yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: There are also those who are obstructed by neither.

original: mngal du nges par @61a * //
analyzed: mngal du nges par @61a * //
translated: The eye of those who die in the womb,

original: 'chi ba dang / dmigs pa gzhan la sems g-yengs pa dang / 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med pa mngon du gyur pa dang / 'jig rten gyi bar dag tu skyes pa rnams kyi mig ni gnyis kar yang mi thogs so //
analyzed: 'chi ba dang / dmigs pa gzhan la sems g-yengs pa dang / 'gog pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med pa mngon du gyur pa dang / 'jig rten gyi bar dag tu skyes pa rnams kyi mig ni gnyis kar yang mi thogs so //
translated: those whose minds are distracted by other objects, those who are absorbed in the meditative attainments of cessation and non-perception, those who are in the state of non-perception, and those born in the intermediate state between two worlds are obstructed by neither.

original: mig gang mtshan mo thogs la zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig gang mtshan mo thogs la zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The eye that is obstructed at night is engaged at night.

original: pha wang zhes bya ba ni lpags pa'i bye'u'o //
analyzed: pha wang zhes bya ba ni lpags pa'i bye'u'o //
translated: The porpoise is a bird with feathers.

original: ming la che'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ming la che'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, like the Chinese.

original: phal che ba smos pa ni kha cig gi mtshan mor yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: phal che ba smos pa ni kha cig gi mtshan mor yang 'jug ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúmostly‚Äù is used because for some, the intermediate state can also occur at night.

original: las dang sman la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang sman la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it depends on karma and medicine.üîΩFor example, like cats, etc.

original: byi la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni stag la sogs pa rnams kyi bsdu'o //
analyzed: byi la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni stag la sogs pa rnams kyi bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes tigers, etc.

original: gnyis kar ma yin zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo ma yin zhing nyin bar ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kar ma yin zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo ma yin zhing nyin bar ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Neither‚Äù means neither night nor day.

original: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩmngal du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi nas //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa // zhes bya ba la / mngal du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi nas //
translated: Except for those modes.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúexcept for those modes‚Äù should be applied to those who die in the womb, etc.

original: 'jig rten gyi bar dag tu skyes pa rnams kyi lta bu'i bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bar dag tu skyes pa rnams kyi lta bu'i bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: up to those who are born in the intermediate state.

original: dper brjod pa 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ni yul dang dus kyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: dper brjod pa 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ni yul dang dus kyis byas pa'o //
translated: The difference between these two examples is made by place and time.

original: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rang gi dmigs pa 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rang gi dmigs pa 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Obstruction of the object field is the apprehension of one‚Äôs object field by minds and mental factors.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na'i rang gi dmigs pa dag la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na'i rang gi dmigs pa dag la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, this is established as the object-field of the mind and mental activities.

original: gang la gang zhig byed pa zhes bya ba ni dper na gzugs la sogs pa dag la mig la sogs pa rnams byed pa lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la gang zhig byed pa zhes bya ba ni dper na gzugs la sogs pa dag la mig la sogs pa rnams byed pa lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is the object-field of what? For example, the eye, etc. have form, etc. as their object-field in the act of seeing, etc.

original: yang byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is this so-called act?

original: nus pa ste /
analyzed: nus pa ste /
translated: It is the capacity.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gang la nus par 'gyur ba 'di ni der nga'i yul yin no zhes smra ba por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gang la nus par 'gyur ba 'di ni der nga'i yul yin no zhes smra ba por 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, that which is capable of what is the object-field of that.

original: gang zhig de'i snang ba skyes pa las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin cing dmigs pa de ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i snang ba skyes pa las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin cing dmigs pa de ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: That which is apprehended and objectified by the mind and mental activities on the basis of the arising of its appearance is the object-field.

original: thogs pa ni 'jug pa brdugs pa yin la /
analyzed: thogs pa ni 'jug pa brdugs pa yin la /
translated: Obstruction is the hindrance to the occurrence of something.

original: 'jug pa ma brdugs pa ni ma brdugs pa yin no zhes 'jig rten na grags pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa ma brdugs pa ni ma brdugs pa yin no zhes 'jig rten na grags pa de'i phyir /
translated: That which is not hindered in its occurrence is unobstructed.

original: yang ji ltar na rang gi yul lam zhes dri brgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na rang gi yul lam zhes dri brgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the question is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the object-field of what?‚Äù

original: de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it does not engage other objects.

original: rnam par shes pa'am dbang po yang rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'am dbang po yang rung ste /
translated: Consciousness or the sense faculty,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i cha shas gang zhig tu zhugs pa de las gzhan du gzhan ni 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i cha shas gang zhig tu zhugs pa de las gzhan du gzhan ni 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: having engaged a part of the form, etc., does not apprehend another part.

original: gang zhig gang gis bsgribs pa de @61b ni de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rung ba'i yul las gzhan du mi 'jug pa thogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis bsgribs pa de @61b ni de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rung ba'i yul las gzhan du mi 'jug pa thogs pa yin no //
translated: Just as that which is obstructed by something does not engage other objects, in the same way, here, obstruction is the non-engagement of the sense faculty in other objects.

original: yang na 'di la gtod pa ni thogs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di la gtod pa ni thogs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Or, obstruction is the directing of the sense faculty to its own object.

original: yul la 'jug pa pa 'di gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: yul la 'jug pa pa 'di gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the engagement of the object?

original: de'i yul gyi ni yul du skye ba yin na yul can ni 'dzin pa'i ngo bor der 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: de'i yul gyi ni yul du skye ba yin na yul can ni 'dzin pa'i ngo bor der 'brel ba ste /
translated: The object is born in the place of the object, and the subject is connected to it in the form of apprehension.

original: de nyid kyi phyir reg pa gsum 'dus pa'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir reg pa gsum 'dus pa'o zhes brjod do //
translated: For this very reason, contact is said to be the coming together of the three.

original: khams bcu thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa yang rnam pa gsum mo zhes bshad pa de la /
analyzed: khams bcu thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa yang rnam pa gsum mo zhes bshad pa de la /
translated: The ten elements are impeded and impeding.üîΩSince it is not known by what impediment they are impeded, it is said:

original: thogs pa gang gis thogs pa dang bcas pa mi shes pa de'i phyir de lta bas na 'dir bcu po 'di dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thogs pa gang gis thogs pa dang bcas pa mi shes pa de'i phyir de lta bas na 'dir bcu po 'di dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, here, these ten are impeded by obstruction to form.

original: phan tshun sgrib pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir phan tshun sgrib par byed do zhes sgrib pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun sgrib pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir phan tshun sgrib par byed do zhes sgrib pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Because they mutually obstruct, this is the cause of impeded and impeding by obstruction to form, since they mutually obstruct because they are accumulations of subtle particles.

original: de lta yin dang sgrib pa la thogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang / mig la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sgrib pa la thogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang / mig la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: If that is so, obstruction to form is the ten elements beginning with form, and obstruction to eye is the ten elements beginning with eye.

original: yul la thogs pa ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: yul la thogs pa ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: Obstruction to object is the ten elements beginning with eye and the mind and mental factors.

original: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: Obstruction to focal object is the mind and mental factors.

original: de'i phyir mu bzhi dang / tshig phyi ma dang yang sbyor bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mu bzhi dang / tshig phyi ma dang yang sbyor bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the four possibilities are to be applied to the last phrase as well.

original: mu dang po ni sems kyi khams bstan pa dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mu dang po ni sems kyi khams bstan pa dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first possibility is the mental constituents and part of the entity constituent.

original: gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa yin pa de ni de rnams kyi yul yang yin pas yul la sogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa yin pa de ni de rnams kyi yul yang yin pas yul la sogs pa yin gyi /
translated: That which is the objective domain of the mind and mental factors is also their object, and so on.

original: sgrib pa la thogs pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrib pa la thogs pas ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not impeded by obstruction to object fields,

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not composites of subtle particles.

original: yul dag ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir sgrib pa la thogs pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: yul dag ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir sgrib pa la thogs pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Object fields are impeded by obstruction to object fields alone, because they are composites of subtle particles.

original: yul la thogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul la thogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not impeded by obstruction to sense faculties,

original: yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not sense faculties.

original: 'di ltar yul dag la ni yul yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dag la ni yul yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In this way, object fields do not have object fields.

original: dbang po dag ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yul can yin pa'i phyir gnyis ka la thogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dag ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yul can yin pa'i phyir gnyis ka la thogs pa yin no //
translated: The sense faculties are impeded by both because they are composites of subtle particles and because they are sense faculties.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for those that are concomitant.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste /
translated: The non-concomitant, the unconditioned, and non-revealing form

original: de dag ni yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir sgrib pa la thogs pa ma yin la /üîΩde dag la @62a * //
analyzed: de dag ni yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir sgrib pa la thogs pa ma yin la / de dag la @62a * //
translated: are not obstructions to the object-field, because they do not exist in a place.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir yul yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir yul yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not object-fields, because they do not have a focal object.

original: gang dag yul la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa de dag dmigs pa la thogs pas kyang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag yul la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa de dag dmigs pa la thogs pas kyang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are those that are obstructed by the object-field also obstructed by the focal object?

original: tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúIn some cases, the latter part of the statement is applied.‚Äù

original: ston par byed pas na tshig ste go bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩtshig gnyis las tshig phyi ma shos gang yin pa des ston par byed pa de ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: ston par byed pas na tshig ste go bar byed ces bya ba'i don to // tshig gnyis las tshig phyi ma shos gang yin pa des ston par byed pa de ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba yin la /
translated: The statement is applied because it is taught. The meaning is that it is understood.üîΩThe latter part of the statement is applied when the latter part of the statement teaches.

original: gang zhig snga mas yin pa de ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig snga mas yin pa de ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba'o //
translated: The former part of the statement is applied when the former part of the statement teaches.

original: re zhig dmigs pa la thogs pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re zhig dmigs pa la thogs pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúFirst, there is obstruction to the object-field.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir yul med par ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul med par ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the mind and mental factors do not occur in the absence of an object-field.

original: / dbang po lnga rnams ni yul la thogs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: / dbang po lnga rnams ni yul la thogs pa kho na yin no //
translated: The five sense faculties are only obstructed with regard to the object-field.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa dang gzugs can rnams la ni dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa dang gzugs can rnams la ni dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-associated formative forces and the material forms are not obstructed with regard to the object-field.

original: gang la yid skye bar 'dod pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang la yid skye bar 'dod pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe mind is obstructed with regard to that which it desires to take as its object.‚Äù

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes ba zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes ba zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The terms mind, thought, and consciousness do not have different meanings.üîΩThe mind desires to take as its object that which the consciousness desires to arise.üîΩThe mind desires to arise in relation to a support and an object-field.

analyzed: gang la rnam par shes pa skye bar 'dod pa ni rten dang dmigs pa gang la'o // skye bar 'dod pa ni 'byung bar 'dod pa ste /
