original: rnam par shes pa skye bar 'dod pa de la gzhan dag gis thogs pa ste /üîΩgang gis na de dag gi rnam par shes pa mi skye bar 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bar 'dod pa de la gzhan dag gis thogs pa ste / gang gis na de dag gi rnam par shes pa mi skye bar 'gyur ba na /
translated: The mind is obstructed by other entities with regard to that which the consciousness desires to arise.

original: bar du sgrib par byar nus pa ste /
analyzed: bar du sgrib par byar nus pa ste /
translated: The mind is obstructed by

original: dper na mig dang gzugs dag gi bar na sgrib pa yod na de dag gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig dang gzugs dag gi bar na sgrib pa yod na de dag gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, when there is an obstruction between the eye and form, consciousness does not arise.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa de ni thogs pa dang bcas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa de ni thogs pa dang bcas par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the eye and so on should be understood as having resistance.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na de dag gi rnam par shes pa skye ba na bar du bsgribs pa ni thogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na de dag gi rnam par shes pa skye ba na bar du bsgribs pa ni thogs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, when their consciousness arises, obstruction in the middle is resistance.

original: de thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Since it is obstructed by that, it has resistance.

original: bzlog pa ni thogs pa med par 'dod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni thogs pa med par 'dod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The opposite is asserted to be without resistance.

original: ji ltar yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams la yod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams la yod kyi /
translated: How is that? The mind element and the phenomena element exist.

original: rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba la gzhan dag gis sgrib par mi nus pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba la gzhan dag gis sgrib par mi nus pa lta bu ste /
translated: Other elements cannot obstruct the generation of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams ni thogs pa med pa'o zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams ni thogs pa med pa'o zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the seven mental elements and the phenomena element are without resistance.

original: lung ma bstan pa brgyad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa brgyad ces bya ba la /
translated: Eight are neutral.

original: ji ltar nges par gzung bar bya //
analyzed: ji ltar nges par gzung bar bya //
translated: How are they ascertained?

original: ci brgyad lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin nam /üîΩ'on te brgyad kho na lung du ma bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci brgyad lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin nam / 'on te brgyad kho na lung du ma bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: Are only the eight neutral?üîΩOr are only the eight neutral?

original: brgyad ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung gi / brgyad kho na lung du ma bstan no zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brgyad ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung gi / brgyad kho na lung du ma bstan no zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, Eight are neutral, but this is said with the intention of specifying that the eight are only neutral, not that only the eight are neutral.

original: gzhan rnam gsum @62b zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum @62b zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, The others are of three types.

original: de dag kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag nyid gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams ma gtogs pa gzhan dag ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag nyid gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams ma gtogs pa gzhan dag ste /
translated: Those that are said to be impeded are the other elements except for the form and sound elements.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are neutral.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not declared to be virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: lung du ma bstan pa dag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, They are neutral.

original: gal te de ltar yin na mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i ngo bor lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir dge ba yang lung du ma bstan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i ngo bor lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir dge ba yang lung du ma bstan par 'gyur la /
translated: If that is so, then because they are not declared to be nonvirtuous or neutral, they would be virtuous.

original: mi dge ba la yang lung du ma bstan par 'gyur te /üîΩdge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i ngo bor lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba la yang lung du ma bstan par 'gyur te / dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i ngo bor lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: Nonvirtue would also be indeterminate because it is indeterminate in terms of its nature as virtuous or indeterminate.

original: rang las lung du ma bstan pa yin dang lung du ma bstan pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rang las lung du ma bstan pa yin dang lung du ma bstan pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: That is not so, because it is indeterminate by itself, and there is no fault of being indeterminate.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung bstan du med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung bstan du med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say: Because it is not declared to have karmic maturation.

original: lung du ma bstan pa la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //üîΩde lta na ni zag pa med pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro // de lta na ni zag pa med pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: They say: Because indeterminate states do not have results.

original: rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa nyid du thal lo //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa nyid du thal lo //
translated: If that were so, then uncontaminated states would also be declared because they do not have karmic maturation.üîΩIt follows that they would be indeterminate.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa gang zhig 'bras bu 'byin par mi nus par de kho na la thal ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa gang zhig 'bras bu 'byin par mi nus par de kho na la thal ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: This consequence applies only to contaminated states that are unable to project their result.

original: gzhan rnam gsum zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say: The three are different.

original: khams zhes bya ba skabs su bab par rjes bsnyag ste /üîΩrnam pa gcig gam /
analyzed: khams zhes bya ba skabs su bab par rjes bsnyag ste / rnam pa gcig gam /
translated: The term dhƒÅtu is to be supplied in each case.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not of two types.

original: de la dge ba ni nad dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de la dge ba ni nad dang bral ba ste /
translated: Therein, the wholesome is the absence of disease.

original: son to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: son to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: it has arrived.

original: yang na ku sha zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: yang na ku sha zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rnam grangs so //
translated: Or else, ku≈õala is a synonym for wisdom.

original: la ni len pa ste /
analyzed: la ni len pa ste /
translated: La means to take up.

original: shes rab kyis yongs su bzung ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis yongs su bzung ba'o //
translated: It is taken up by wisdom.

original: yang na dge ba ni shes rab yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o /
analyzed: yang na dge ba ni shes rab yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o /
translated: Or else, the wholesome is that which causes the taking up of wisdom.

original: de lta yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, there is the fault of overextension.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa kho na dang mngon par 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa kho na dang mngon par 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is only that which is distinguished that is meant.

original: de la sems kyi khams bdun ni don dam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / kun nas slong bas dge bar ma gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la sems kyi khams bdun ni don dam pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / kun nas slong bas dge bar ma gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therein, the seven mental elements are not wholesome by nature, because they are not ultimately wholesome and because they are not the motivating force of what is wholesome.

original: de'i phyir ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa dag ni dge ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa dag ni dge ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says: those that are concomitant with nonattachment, etc. are wholesome.

original: chags pa la sogs pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: Those that are associated with attachment and so on are nonvirtuous.

original: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
translated: The others are neutral, such as those that arise from karmic maturation.

original: chos kyi khams ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la /üîΩma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / ngo @63a * //
analyzed: chos kyi khams ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la / ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / ngo @63a * //
translated: The element of mental objects is virtuous by its intrinsic nature, such as the absence of attachment and so on.

original: tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / chos lnga po de dag ni rang gi ngo bos dge ba yin gyi /
analyzed: tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / chos lnga po de dag ni rang gi ngo bos dge ba yin gyi /
translated: The absence of attachment, the absence of hatred, the absence of delusion, shame, embarrassment, and the five such as faith are virtuous by their intrinsic nature.

original: gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pas ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not virtuous by being associated with something else.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba gzhan gang dag / ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho nas dge ba yin gyi /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba gzhan gang dag / ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho nas dge ba yin gyi /
translated: Other mental factors such as feeling that are associated with the absence of attachment and so on are virtuous only by being associated with them.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not virtuous by their intrinsic nature.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba skye ba la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang ste /
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba skye ba la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang ste /
translated: The non-associated formative forces such as birth, etc., which are motivated by non-attachment, etc., and also non-informative form.

original: 'di dag gi dge ba nyid ni kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag gi dge ba nyid ni kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis yin gyi /
translated: Their virtue is due to the motivating force.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not due to association or essential nature.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba ni don dam pas dge ba yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba ni don dam pas dge ba yin no //
translated: Cessation due to deliberation is ultimate virtue.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The essential nature of attachment, etc.

original: chags pa dang / sdang ba dang / gti mug dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni rang gi ngo bos mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang / sdang ba dang / gti mug dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni rang gi ngo bos mi dge ba'o //
translated: Attachment, hatred, delusion, shamelessness, and lack of abashment are non-virtue by their essential nature.

original: chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Feeling, etc., which are associated with attachment, etc., are non-virtue by association.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni kun nas slong ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni kun nas slong ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: Birth, etc., and non-informative form are non-virtue by the motivating force.

original: gzhan ni lung ma bstan pa yin no zhes pa ni gang zhig dge ba dang mi dge ba'i nang gi ngo bo dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ; de dag gi kun nas slong ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni lung ma bstan pa yin no zhes pa ni gang zhig dge ba dang mi dge ba'i nang gi ngo bo dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ; de dag gi kun nas slong ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is neither the nature of virtue nor nonvirtue, nor concomitant with them, nor motivated by them is neutral.

original: dper na nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ji skad du bshad pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba ldan pa ma yin pa dag go ;
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ji skad du bshad pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba ldan pa ma yin pa dag go ;
translated: For example, space, nonanalytical cessation, and feeling, etc., concomitant with neutral minds, and nonconcomitant states motivated by the neutral minds explained above.

original: / gzugs dang sgra'i khams dag ni kun nas bslang ba'i dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid do //üîΩlus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / gzugs dang sgra'i khams dag ni kun nas bslang ba'i dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid do // lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The elements of form and sound are virtuous or nonvirtuous by motivation.üîΩThe form element is subsumed by the indicative form of body and speech.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus la /
translated: The form element is subsumed by the indicative form of body and speech.

original: sgra'i khams ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: sgra'i khams ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus so //
translated: The sound element is included in the intimation of speech.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The others are indeterminate.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed las tha dad pa'i gzugs dang / sgra thams cad do //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed las tha dad pa'i gzugs dang / sgra thams cad do //
translated: The form that is the intimation of body and speech, and all form that is distinct from the intimation, and all sound, are indeterminate, because they are motivated by an indeterminate mind.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba bshad zin to //
translated: The classification of virtue, etc. has been explained.

original: 'dod khams @63b gtogs pa thams cad do //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod khams @63b gtogs pa thams cad do // zhes bya ba la /
translated: All belong to the realm of desire.

original: gtogs pa ni ma bral ba ste /
analyzed: gtogs pa ni ma bral ba ste /
translated: Belonging means not being free from desire.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The realm of desire is the nature of desire.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is appropriated by craving that operates in the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams na bcu bzhi'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na bcu bzhi'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the form realm, there are fourteen.

original: gzugs kyi khams na na khams bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na na khams bcu bzhi ste /
translated: In the form realm, there are fourteen elements.

original: gzugs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams la gzugs dag ces brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams la gzugs dag ces brjod do //
translated: The form realm is called form because form is primary there.

original: yang ji ltar na bcu bzhir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩdri dang ro dang sna dang ni //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na bcu bzhir 'gyur zhe na / dri dang ro dang sna dang ni //
translated: How then is there a total of fourteen?

original: lce yi rnam shes khams ma gtogs //
analyzed: lce yi rnam shes khams ma gtogs //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúExcept for the smell, taste, nose, and tongue

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: consciousnesses.‚Äù

original: de gnyis ni zhes bya ba ni dri dang / ro gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni zhes bya ba ni dri dang / ro gnyis so //
translated: ‚Äú Those two‚Äù refers to smell and taste.

original: de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang der skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang der skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Because those who are free from attachment to those two are born there.

original: kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams gzugs kyi khams su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams gzugs kyi khams su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the desire realm are born in the form realm.

original: dri dang ro med pas sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa gnyis kyang med de /
analyzed: dri dang ro med pas sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa gnyis kyang med de /
translated: Since there is no smell or taste in the form realm, there is no nose consciousness or tongue consciousness.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no object.

original: gang gi phyir yul med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni 'ga' yang mi skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni 'ga' yang mi skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Consciousness never arises without an object.

original: dper na gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, in the formless realm, there is no consciousness of form, sound, and so on.

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: If that is so, then the root text states, ‚ÄúExcept for the smell, taste, nose, and tongue consciousnesses.‚Äù

original: kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //
analyzed: kham gyi zas ni 'dod pa na //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIn the desire realm, there is also the body consciousness.‚Äù

original: skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The three sense spheres are its intrinsic nature.

original: zhes bya bas dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams kyang kham gyi zas yin pa'i phyir med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bas dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams kyang kham gyi zas yin pa'i phyir med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the elements of smell, taste, and tactility would also be absent in the form realm, because they are material food.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi khams na bcu gnyis so zhes brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi khams na bcu gnyis so zhes brjod par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, it should be said that there are twelve elements in the form realm,

original: bcu bzhi zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcu bzhi zhes ni mi bya'o //

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is not that they arise due to the power of a need, the master says.

original: 'o na ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig ce na /
translated: What then?

original: smras pa / rgyu'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu'i dbang gis te /
translated: It is said: due to the power of a cause.

original: de'i phyir rgyu yod na mi mdzes par byed bzhin du yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu yod na mi mdzes par byed bzhin du yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //

original: yang de'i rgyu gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang de'i rgyu gang zhig ce na /

original: de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i las kyi khyad par sred pa sngon du 'gro ba can no //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i las kyi khyad par sred pa sngon du 'gro ba can no //

original: 'o na ni mdo @65b las zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni mdo @65b las zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis smras pa'o //

original: khas blangs pa la gnod pa smras pa ste /
analyzed: khas blangs pa la gnod pa smras pa ste /

original: gal te pho'i dbang po ltar sna dang lce'i dbang po gnyis der mi skye na'o //
analyzed: gal te pho'i dbang po ltar sna dang lce'i dbang po gnyis der mi skye na'o //
translated: If the nose and tongue faculties do not arise there, like the male faculty.

original: mdo gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: mdo gang zhig ce na /
translated: Which s≈´tra?

original: dbang po rnams ma tshang ba med cing med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ma tshang ba med cing med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe faculties are not incomplete and not deficient there.‚Äù

original: de na dbang po gang dag srid pa zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis lung dang 'gal ba spong ba smras pa ste /
analyzed: de na dbang po gang dag srid pa zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis lung dang 'gal ba spong ba smras pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhich faculties are possible there?‚Äù The Master says this to remove the contradiction with the scriptures.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / lus kyi dbang po dag gis yin gyi sna dang lce'i dbang po 'dod pa na spyod pa dag gis dbang po rnams med pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / lus kyi dbang po dag gis yin gyi sna dang lce'i dbang po 'dod pa na spyod pa dag gis dbang po rnams med pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: It shows that the faculties are not incomplete there because the eye, ear, and body faculties exist there, but it does not show that the faculties are not incomplete there because the nose and tongue faculties that exist in the desire realm exist there.

original: slob dpon nyid kyis de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: slob dpon nyid kyis de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: The Master himself says, ‚ÄúIf that is not so,‚Äù

original: / de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: / de lta ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is not so,üîΩif you do not assert that the faculties are not incomplete there because the faculties that exist there exist there,

original: de na dbang po gang dag srid pa de dag gis dbang po rnams med pa ma yin no zhes de ltar mi 'dod na ni /
analyzed: de na dbang po gang dag srid pa de dag gis dbang po rnams med pa ma yin no zhes de ltar mi 'dod na ni /
translated: then

original: sna dang ce'i dbang po gnyis ji lta ba bzhin du pho'i dbang po la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sna dang ce'i dbang po gnyis ji lta ba bzhin du pho'i dbang po la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The same reductio would apply to the male organ as to the nose and tongue organs.

original: gal te 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas dbang po rnams med pa ma yin par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas dbang po rnams med pa ma yin par 'gyur na'o //
translated: If it were not so, then the organs would not exist from the point of view of those who live in the desire realm.

original: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis smras pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù refers to what the former masters have said.

original: lus kyi sgo nas skye mched drug pa sred pa kun du spyod kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas skye mched drug pa sred pa kun du spyod kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúCraving is active through the six sense spheres that are based on the body.‚Äù

original: 'di la bdag tu nga rgyal ba gzhag pas ni skye mched drug lus yin te /
analyzed: 'di la bdag tu nga rgyal ba gzhag pas ni skye mched drug lus yin te /
translated: Here, the six sense spheres are the body, because the pride of self is posited on the basis of them.

original: nga 'am bdag gi snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga 'am bdag gi snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one thinks ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir khyad par med par skye mched drug la sred pa 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par med par skye mched drug la sred pa 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, craving operates on the six sense spheres without distinction.

original: yul gyi sgo nas ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni yul dmigs pa'i sgo nas ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yul gyi sgo nas ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni yul dmigs pa'i sgo nas ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot through the object‚Äù means not through the object that is perceived.

original: de'i phyir yul la 'dod chags dang bral bas de'i 'dzin par byed pa dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul la 'dod chags dang bral bas de'i 'dzin par byed pa dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one who is free from attachment to the object is not free from attachment to the sense faculty that apprehends it.

original: 'khrig pa'i reg pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni pho'i dbang po las 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /üîΩ'khrig pa'i reg pa'i sgo nas de la sred pa 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i reg pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni pho'i dbang po las 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur te / 'khrig pa'i reg pa'i sgo nas de la sred pa 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to sexual contact are not free from attachment to the male faculty,üîΩbecause craving engages it through the medium of sexual contact.

original: 'khrig pa'i reg pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i reg pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that craving engages it through the medium of the object of sexual contact.

original: gal te pho'i dbang po yang yul gyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir skye mched drug gis bsdus pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te pho'i dbang po yang yul gyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir skye mched drug gis bsdus pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the male faculty is also included in the six sense bases because it is included in the sense base of form,üîΩthen why does the Abhidharmako≈õa state, ‚ÄúThe male and female faculties are not included in the six sense bases‚Äù?

original: lus las pho dang mo dbang dag / ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir de la lus kyi sgo nas sred pa 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: lus las pho dang mo dbang dag / ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir de la lus kyi sgo nas sred pa 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It is said that craving engages the male faculty through the body,üîΩbut it does not engage it through the medium of the object of the male faculty.

original: pho'i dbang po yang dag par grub par byed pa'i las ni 'khrig pa'i reg pa la sred pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /üîΩde'i @66a * //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po yang dag par grub par byed pa'i las ni 'khrig pa'i reg pa la sred pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te / de'i @66a * //
translated: The function of the female organ is to generate the female faculty.

original: phyir 'di la yul gyi sgo nas sred pa kun du spyod kyi /
analyzed: phyir 'di la yul gyi sgo nas sred pa kun du spyod kyi /
translated: Therefore, craving is active in these two faculties with respect to objects,

original: lus kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with respect to the body.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na khams dag du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na khams dag du zhig yod ce na /
translated: How many elements are there in the formless realm?

original: gzugs med gtogs pa yid dang ni //
analyzed: gzugs med gtogs pa yid dang ni //
translated: The formless realm is associated with the mind,

original: chos dang yid kyi rnam shes khams //
analyzed: chos dang yid kyi rnam shes khams //
translated: the mental object, and the mind-consciousness element.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is stated.

original: khams gsum po 'di dag kho na yin gyis gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum po 'di dag kho na yin gyis gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: These are the three realms, there are no others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skyes te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skyes te /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to form are born there.

original: de'i phyir de na gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩdbang po'i khams lnga dang / yul gyi khams lnga med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de na gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba smos te / dbang po'i khams lnga dang / yul gyi khams lnga med la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the formless realm is free from form.üîΩThe five sense-faculty elements and the five object elements do not exist there,

original: de dag la brten pa dang dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga la yang med do //
analyzed: de dag la brten pa dang dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga la yang med do //
translated: nor do the five consciousness elements that are supported on and have as their objects those elements.

original: mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa de dag go rims bzhin rten dang dmigs pa gang rnams la yod pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de rnams ni de dag la brten pa dang dmigs pa yin te /üîΩgo rims bzhin du mig la sogs pa rten yin zhing /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa de dag go rims bzhin rten dang dmigs pa gang rnams la yod pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de rnams ni de dag la brten pa dang dmigs pa yin te / go rims bzhin du mig la sogs pa rten yin zhing /
translated: The eye and so on, and the form and so on, are the basis and the object of the eye consciousness and so on, respectively.üîΩThe eye and so on are the basis of the eye consciousness and so on, respectively.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Form and so on are the objects of the eye consciousness and so on, respectively.

original: 'di ltar rten med pa dang dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten med pa dang dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, consciousness does not exist without a basis and without an object,

original: rnam par shes pa ni gnyis la brten nas skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gnyis la brten nas skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that consciousness arises in dependence on two factors.

original: de'i phyir de na mig la sogs pa rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams med pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de na mig la sogs pa rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams med pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams med do //
translated: Therefore, since the eye and so on and form and so on do not exist in the formless realm, the eye consciousness and so on do not exist there.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i rnam pa'i skabs su babs pas gang dag lam gyi bden pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i rnam pa'i skabs su babs pas gang dag lam gyi bden pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba la /
translated: The topic under discussion is the aspects of the contaminated and the uncontaminated.

original: bden pa smos pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam bzlog par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bden pa smos pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam bzlog par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term truth is mentioned in order to exclude the mundane path,

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pas bsdus pa'i phyir lam gyi bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pas bsdus pa'i phyir lam gyi bden pa ma yin no //
translated: because the mundane path is not the truth of the path, since it is included in the truths of suffering and origin.

original: de la lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa'i chos kyi khams ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dang / sems las byung ba rnams dang / ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed zag pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa'i chos kyi khams ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dang / sems las byung ba rnams dang / ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed zag pa med pa rnams so //
translated: The element of mental objects included in the truth of the path is uncontaminated vows, mental factors, and the formations that are not associated with the mind.

original: lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa'i yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag ni zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa'i yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dag ni zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The mental element and the mental consciousness element included in the truth of the path are uncontaminated consciousness.

original: 'dus ma byas ni chos kyi khams kho nas bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni chos kyi khams kho nas bsdus so //
translated: The unconditioned is included only in the element of mental objects.

original: lhag ma rnams ni zag bcas so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni zag bcas so //
translated: The rest are contaminated.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: ni'i sgra ni lhag ma rnams zag @66b pa dang bcas pa kho na'o zhes nges par bzung ba dang / rim pa bzhin du sbyor bar rig bar bya'o //üîΩrtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni lhag ma rnams zag @66b pa dang bcas pa kho na'o zhes nges par bzung ba dang / rim pa bzhin du sbyor bar rig bar bya'o // rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa ni //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is to be supplied in the above verse, and it is to be understood that the remaining are only with-outflows.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five consciousnesses are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought.

original: ni'i sgra ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes nges par bzung ba'i don no //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes nges par bzung ba'i don no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is to be supplied in the above verse, and it is to be understood that the five consciousnesses are only accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought.

original: de'i phyir / 'di dag ni rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di dag ni rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThese are always accompanied by these five. ‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag rtag tu rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag rtag tu rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
translated: Why are these always accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought?

original: 'di ltar de dag kha phyi rol tu bltas pa'i phyir rtsing ba dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / rjes su 'brel ba'i sa na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag kha phyi rol tu bltas pa'i phyir rtsing ba dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / rjes su 'brel ba'i sa na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are coarse, and because applied thought and sustained thought are associated with the level of the first two meditations.

original: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The last three are of three kinds.üîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is to be supplied in the above verse, and it is to be understood that the last three are only of three kinds.

original: ci ltar nges par gzung zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar nges par gzung zhe na /
translated: How are they determined?

original: tha ma gsum kho na rnam pa gsum mo zhes nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: tha ma gsum kho na rnam pa gsum mo zhes nges par gzung ngo //
translated: The last three are only of three types.

original: mthar 'don pa'i phyir na tha ma'o //
analyzed: mthar 'don pa'i phyir na tha ma'o //
translated: The last is so called because it is the last.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa med pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa mi srid pa de'i phyir ;
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa med pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa mi srid pa de'i phyir ;
translated: Since there is no concomitant investigation and analysis in the dissociated factors, those that possess investigation and analysis are impossible.

original: chos kyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: chos kyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúthe element of mental objects,‚Äù and so on.

original: chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa smos pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis la yang thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa smos pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis la yang thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Since the element of mental objects is mentioned as a concomitant, it follows that investigation and analysis are also mentioned.

original: de dag la yang rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis pa med pas rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de dag la yang rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis pa med pas rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa mi srid do //
translated: But since there is no second investigation and analysis in those two, those that possess investigation and analysis are impossible.

original: de'i phyir / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúother than investigation and analysis.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan dang po'i gong na rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / bsam gtan khyad par can gyi gong na dpyod pa med pa'i phyir dang / khams tha ma dag kyang khams gsum pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po na ni zhes bya ba smos te 'dod pa'i khams dang /üîΩbsam gtan dang po dag na ni gang zhig rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i gong na rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / bsam gtan khyad par can gyi gong na dpyod pa med pa'i phyir dang / khams tha ma dag kyang khams gsum pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po na ni zhes bya ba smos te 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dag na ni gang zhig rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan par 'gyur ba /
translated: in the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa spangs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnam pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa spangs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnam pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the desire realm and the first absorption, there is no mental or mental factor that is not concomitant with investigation and analysis.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can rtog pa med pa'i gong na yang yod pas de'i phyir bsam gtan khyad par can ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dag yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can rtog pa med pa'i gong na yang yod pas de'i phyir bsam gtan khyad par can ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dag yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because there is no investigation above the special absorption, he says, the special absorption is without investigation and possesses only analysis.

original: dpyod pa kho na dang mtshungs par ldan gyi /
analyzed: dpyod pa kho na dang mtshungs par ldan gyi /
translated: It is concomitant with analysis alone.

original: rtog pa dang ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not conceptualization.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la /üîΩbsam gtan khyad par can @67a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la / bsam gtan khyad par can @67a * //
translated: From the second meditative concentration on up,

original: gyi gong na rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pas mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyi gong na rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pas mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no joy and no investigation and analysis.

original: chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad kyang gnyis ga ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad kyang gnyis ga ma yin pa ste /
translated: All that is not associated with the element of mental objects is neither.

original: thams cad smos pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sa bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sa bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The term all is used to include the conditioned and the unconditioned, and to include the stages.

original: / bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa ni zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: / bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa ni zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The investigation of the special meditative absorption is not conceptualization because there is no conceptualization, and it is not analysis because there is no second analysis.

original: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa dag yin no zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa dag yin no zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: It is neither conceptualization nor analysis.

original: rtog pa ni rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rtag tu rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa ni rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rtag tu rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam yin te /
translated: Conceptualization is always devoid of conception and possesses investigation alone because it is concomitant with investigation.

original: dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir na dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir na dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It possesses investigation because it is concomitant with investigation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i dpyod pa ni rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gi nang du mi 'du na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i dpyod pa ni rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gi nang du mi 'du na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since investigation of the desire realm and first absorption is not included in these three types,

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa'i nang du'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa'i nang du'o //
translated: it is not included in the category possessing conception and investigation, the category possessing investigation alone, or the category possessing neither conception nor investigation.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩre zhig rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba rnam pa dang po'i nang du ni mi 'du ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / re zhig rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba rnam pa dang po'i nang du ni mi 'du ste /
translated: How is that?

original: dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, it is not included in the category possessing conception and investigation because it lacks the second type of conception.

original: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam yang mi srid de /
analyzed: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam yang mi srid de /
translated: It is also impossible for it to possess investigation alone and be devoid of conception.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po na rtog pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po na rtog pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with investigation in the desire realm and the first meditative absorption, and because there is no second type of analysis.

original: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa mi srid de /
analyzed: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible for there to be neither investigation nor analysis.

original: rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with investigation.

original: de ji skad du brjod par bya zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dpyod pa la'o //
analyzed: de ji skad du brjod par bya zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dpyod pa la'o //
translated: What is it called? It is the analysis that exists in the desire realm and the first meditative absorption.

original: de'i phyir / dpyod pa med cing rtog pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dpyod pa med cing rtog pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is only investigation, not analysis.

original: dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no second type of analysis and because it is associated with investigation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: For that very reason

original: gang gi phyir de na dpyod pa rnam pa gsum po dag tu mi 'du ba de'i phyir de la gzhan du rnam par gzhag par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de na dpyod pa rnam pa gsum po dag tu mi 'du ba de'i phyir de la gzhan du rnam par gzhag par byed do //
translated: because that analysis is not included in the three types, it is established as something else.

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The first phrase is the stage with applied and sustained thought.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po na'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po na'o //
translated: The first phrase is the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: rnam pa dang po ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dang po ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first type is associated with applied thought and sustained thought.

original: rnam pa gnyis pa @67b ni dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa @67b ni dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second type is associated with sustained thought and does not have a second type of applied thought.

original: rnam pa gsum pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The third type is not associated with either.

original: rnam pa bzhi pa ni rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi pa ni rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth type is associated with applied thought and does not have a second type of sustained thought.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka spangs //üîΩzhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka spangs // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The remaining are both abandoned.

original: ji ltar nges par gzung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nges par gzung zhe na /
translated: How are they ascertained?

original: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka spangs pa nyid do zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka spangs pa nyid do zhes bya bar ro //
translated: The remaining are both abandoned.

original: de gnyis dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa spangs pa ste /
translated: Because they are not concomitant with those two, they are devoid of investigation and analysis.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de'i phyir ro // gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: They are not by nature mind or mental factors.üîΩIf the five collections of consciousness are devoid of investigation and analysis, how can they be devoid of conceptuality?

original: rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ji ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya /
analyzed: rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ji ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya /
translated: If investigation is conceptuality, how can those concomitant with it be devoid of conceptuality?

original: yang rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces gang du bshad ce na /
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces gang du bshad ce na /
translated: And where is it explained that they are devoid of conceptuality?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na de dang de las rnam par rtog pa can nyid du bstan pas don gyis rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rtog pa med par bshad do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na de dang de las rnam par rtog pa can nyid du bstan pas don gyis rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rtog pa med par bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the five collections of consciousness are devoid of investigation because it is taught that only mental consciousness is conceptual and by implication the five collections of consciousness are devoid of investigation.

original: gzhan yang gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsungs te /
translated: Also, it is said:

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las kun nas slong bar mi byed do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las kun nas slong bar mi byed do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are devoid of conceptuality, they do not motivate physical and verbal karma.

original: nges par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par mi rtog go zhes rnam par rtog pa med pa dag yin gyi /üîΩngo bo nyid kyis rnam par rtog pas rnam par mi rtog pa ni ma yin no //üîΩrnam par rtog pas ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes grag ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nges par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par mi rtog go zhes rnam par rtog pa med pa dag yin gyi / ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par rtog pas rnam par mi rtog pa ni ma yin no // rnam par rtog pas ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes grag ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not conceptualized by the conceptualization that is definite knowledge or the conceptualization that is memory.üîΩThey are not non-conceptual by nature.üîΩIt is said that conceptualization is of three kinds.

original: grag ste'i sgras ni bye brag tu smra ba'i tshig yin par ston to //üîΩde bas na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa yod mod kyi /üîΩnges par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa med do //üîΩde'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: grag ste'i sgras ni bye brag tu smra ba'i tshig yin par ston to //üîΩde bas na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa yod mod kyi /üîΩnges par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa med do //üîΩde'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya ste /

original: dper na rta rkang gcig pa la rkang pa'i bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir rkang med ces bya ba de bzhin du dmigs pa nges par rtog pa dang / mngon par brjod pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gcig pa dag la yang rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na rta rkang gcig pa la rkang pa'i bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir rkang med ces bya ba de bzhin du dmigs pa nges par rtog pa dang / mngon par brjod pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gcig pa dag la yang rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the two that are single conceptualizations are called ‚Äúnon-conceptual‚Äù because they lack the conceptualization of an object and the conceptualization of verbalization.

original: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang rnam par rtog pa gcig pa yod pa ma yin nam /üîΩdper na bsam gtan gnyis @68a * //
analyzed: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang rnam par rtog pa gcig pa yod pa ma yin nam / dper na bsam gtan gnyis @68a * //
translated: If mental consciousness is also single conceptualization,

original: pa la sogs pa dag gi mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa kho nas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa dag gi mnyam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa kho nas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: for example, the meditative equipoise of the second concentration and so on is conceptual because it is conceptualized by the conceptualization of recollection.

original: yod mod kyi /
analyzed: yod mod kyi /
translated: It is true that it is so,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rigs la bsams nas de skad bshad do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rigs la bsams nas de skad bshad do //
translated: but it is explained in that way with the type of mental consciousness in mind.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang ; bsam gtan dang po'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis rnam par rtog pa dang bcas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang ; bsam gtan dang po'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis rnam par rtog pa dang bcas so //
translated: The mental consciousness of the desire realm and the first meditative absorption that is not in equipoise is associated with all three types of conceptuality.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i mnyam par bzhag pa dang / gnyis pa la sogs pa dag gis mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni gnyis kyis yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i mnyam par bzhag pa dang / gnyis pa la sogs pa dag gis mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni gnyis kyis yin la /
translated: The mental consciousness in equipoise of the first meditative absorption and that not in equipoise of the second meditative absorption and so on is associated with two types of conceptuality.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa ni gcig gis so //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa ni gcig gis so //
translated: The mental consciousness in equipoise of the second meditative absorption and so on is associated with one type of conceptuality.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni rtog pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa ni rtog pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among them, the essential nature of conceptuality is conception.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni rtsing ba'i phyir rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid des rnam par rtog pa can yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni rtsing ba'i phyir rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid des rnam par rtog pa can yin te /
translated: The five collections of consciousness are by nature conception because they are coarse.

original: de de dag la mtshungs par ldan bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de dag la mtshungs par ldan bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are associated with that conception because it exists in association with them.

original: 'dir sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ston pa'i skabs su ma bab po zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ston pa'i skabs su ma bab po zhe na /
translated: Here it is not the right occasion to teach the nature of mental factors.

original: de'i phyir / de ni 'og nas sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ni 'og nas sems las byung ba dag gi nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said below, ‚Äúamong the mental factors‚Äù and so on.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa rtsing zhib nyid ces bya ba de gnas so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa rtsing zhib nyid ces bya ba de gnas so //
translated: The coarseness and subtlety of investigation and analysis are established.

original: nges par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag gis ni gnas skabs kyis gzhag pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni gdon mi za bar 'di nyid du brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: nges par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag gis ni gnas skabs kyis gzhag pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni gdon mi za bar 'di nyid du brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: The characteristics of that very state are definitely to be expressed here by the conceptualization of determination and the conceptualization of memory,

original: gzhan du gnas skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gnas skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other state.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: gzhan dag gi rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúthe nature of the others.‚Äù

original: shes rab ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba dang / yid las byung ba yang yod la /
analyzed: shes rab ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba dang / yid las byung ba yang yod la /
translated: Wisdom is sometimes generated together with eye consciousness and so on, and sometimes it is mental.

original: yid las byung ba yang mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: yid las byung ba yang mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod pas de'i phyir /
translated: Also, mental wisdom is sometimes in equipoise and sometimes not in equipoise.

original: yid kyi shes rab g-yeng zhes khyad par gnyis nye bar bzung ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi shes rab g-yeng zhes khyad par gnyis nye bar bzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, mental wisdom is distracted is stated with two distinctions.

original: aa gra ni dmigs pa la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: aa gra ni dmigs pa la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: The desire to focus on an object is the desire to focus on an object.

original: dmigs pa dang bral ba ni g-yeng ba dang / dmigs pa sna tshogs te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bral ba ni g-yeng ba dang / dmigs pa sna tshogs te /
translated: The distraction of being separated from the object is the distraction of various objects.

original: dmigs pa gzhan la g-yengs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa gzhan la g-yengs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is distracted by other objects.

original: ci'i phyir de nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog par brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog par brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it called the conceptualization of determination?

original: ming la ltos nas dmigs pa gzhan la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ming la ltos nas dmigs pa gzhan la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it engages other objects in dependence on names.

original: gzugs so // tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs so // tshor ba'o //
translated: It is form, it is feeling,

original: 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'du shes so //
translated: it is conception,

original: 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed do //
translated: it is formation,üîΩit is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'o snyam du @68b nges par rtog pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa nges par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'o snyam du @68b nges par rtog pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa nges par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impermanent, it is painful, it is empty, it is without self.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab mnyam par gzhag pa ni ming la mi ltos pa kho nar dmigs pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab mnyam par gzhag pa ni ming la mi ltos pa kho nar dmigs pa la 'jug ste /
translated: The wisdom that arises from meditation is equipoise that engages the object without depending on names.

original: des na mnyam par ma bzhag pa gang yin pa de ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: des na mnyam par ma bzhag pa gang yin pa de ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Therefore, that which is nonequipoise is the conceptualization of determination.

original: ming gi dbang gis don la nges par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming gi dbang gis don la nges par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one definitely understands the object through the power of the name.

original: shes rab mnyam par gzhag pa ni ming la ltos pa med pa'i phyir don 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: shes rab mnyam par gzhag pa ni ming la ltos pa med pa'i phyir don 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: When wisdom is in equipoise, it focuses on the object alone, because it does not depend on the name.

original: yid kyi dran pa thams cad nyid //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyi dran pa thams cad nyid // ces bya ba la /
translated: All mental memoryüîΩThe term ‚Äúall‚Äù

original: thams cad smos pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa gzung bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa gzung bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: refers to both equipoise and nonequipoise.

original: yid smos pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dran pa'i bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid smos pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dran pa'i bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúmental‚Äù is used to exclude memory that is concomitant with the eye consciousness and so on.

original: dmigs pa mngon par brjod pa yid yin pa'i phyir dang / ming nges par rtog pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa mngon par brjod pa yid yin pa'i phyir dang / ming nges par rtog pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: The object is expressed by the mind because it is the mind that conceptualizes the name and does not depend on the name.

original: dran pa mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa thams cad kho na rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa thams cad kho na rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //

analyzed: bcu zhes ma yin no //

original: sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par gzung ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba dag gi nang du ma 'dus par ston te /
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par gzung ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba dag gi nang du ma 'dus par ston te /
translated: The elements are determined as having the characteristics of solidity, etc., in order to show that the eye, etc., and form, etc., are not included among the elements.

original: sra ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they do not have the same intrinsic nature and characteristics as solidity, etc.,

original: @70b tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: @70b tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin no //

original: yang ji ltar de rnams 'byung ba dag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par khong du chud ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de rnams 'byung ba dag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par khong du chud ce na /
translated: How do you understand that they are not the same as the elements?

original: 'byung ba de dag reg bya yin pa'i phyir dang / reg pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba de dag reg bya yin pa'i phyir dang / reg pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the elements are tangible objects and objects of touch.

original: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can du khyad par med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa thams cad dbang po thams cad kyi gzung bar bya bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can du khyad par med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa thams cad dbang po thams cad kyi gzung bar bya bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: If all form, etc., were not distinguished as having the intrinsic nature of the elements, all form, etc., would be apprehended by all faculties.

original: de'i phyir dbang po du ma don med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po du ma don med par 'gyur na /
translated: And therefore the many faculties would be meaningless.

original: de ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa yang ma yin no //

original: mig la sogs pas kyang ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pas kyang ste /
translated: The eye, etc., are also not the same as the elements.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce rnams kyis ni sra ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce rnams kyis ni sra ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The eye, ear, nose, and tongue faculties do not apprehend the hardness, etc.

original: sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / yang zhing g-yo ba nyid dag mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / yang zhing g-yo ba nyid dag mi 'dzin te /
translated: , of earth, etc. because hardness, fluidity, heat, and motion are not apprehended by the eye, ear, nose, and tongue faculties.

original: de'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, earth, etc. are not of the nature of form, etc.

original: lus kyi dbang pos kyang kha dog la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang pos kyang kha dog la sogs pa ste /

original: kha dog dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dag 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dag 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: because color, sound, odor, and taste are not apprehended by the body faculty.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, form, etc. are not of the nature of the elements.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams ni yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / yul nges pa'i phyir yul dag dang rang bzhin tha dad pa dang / phan tshun rang bzhin tha dad par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams ni yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / yul nges pa'i phyir yul dag dang rang bzhin tha dad pa dang / phan tshun rang bzhin tha dad par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The eye, etc. should be understood as having a different nature from their objects because they are subjects and because their objects are determined.

original: de'i phyir skye mched bcu po dag ni 'byung ba tsam ma yin par grub bo ;
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched bcu po dag ni 'byung ba tsam ma yin par grub bo ;
translated: Therefore, it is established that the ten faculties are not mere elements.

original: /'di ni re zhig rigs pa yin no //üîΩda ni lung ston te /
analyzed: /'di ni re zhig rigs pa yin no // da ni lung ston te /
translated: This is the reasoning.üîΩNow, the scriptures will be explained.

original: mdo las dge slong dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mdo las dge slong dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The s≈´tra says:

analyzed: gzugs su rung bas na gzugs te /
