original: gnod par byar rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod par byar rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is suitable to be harmed.

original: de 'di la yod pas na mig la sogs pa'i skye mched la gzugs can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na mig la sogs pa'i skye mched la gzugs can zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called form because it exists in the sense bases of eye, etc.

original: reg bya'i skye mched kho nas 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag go zhes bya bar gsungs kyi /
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched kho nas 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag go zhes bya bar gsungs kyi /
translated: The four great elements are included in the sense base of tactility alone.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The sense bases of eye, etc. are not.

original: rgyu byas pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu byas pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, ‚Äúhaving already performed the function of cause.üîΩ‚Äù Since the elements are included in the sense base of tactility alone, the remainder, the sense bases of eye, etc. and smoothness, etc. are not the elements.

original: reg bya'i skye mched kyi phyogs gcig kho nas 'byung ba rnams bsdus pa'i phyir lhag ma mig la sogs pa dang / 'jam ba nyid la sogs pa ni 'byung ba dag ma yin no zhes bya bar gsal bar kun du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched kyi phyogs gcig kho nas 'byung ba rnams bsdus pa'i phyir lhag ma mig la sogs pa dang / 'jam ba nyid la sogs pa ni 'byung ba dag ma yin no zhes bya bar gsal bar kun du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is clearly taught.

original: thams cad du 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin na reg bya'i skye mched kho na rnam pa gnyis su bstan gyi /üîΩmig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ma yin pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kho na rnam pa @71a * //
analyzed: thams cad du 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin na reg bya'i skye mched kho na rnam pa gnyis su bstan gyi / mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ma yin pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kho na rnam pa @71a * //
translated: If it is the nature of all to be elements, then why are only the tactile objects taught to be twofold?üîΩWhy are only the eye sources, etc. taught to be one type?

original: gcig tu bstan gyi /
analyzed: gcig tu bstan gyi /
translated: Why are only the tactile objects taught to be twofold?

original: reg bya'i skye mched ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gnyis rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas rgyu gzhan po ma yin pa ma yin te /üîΩde'i phyir mdo dang 'gal bas skye mched bcu po dag 'byung ba tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gnyis rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas rgyu gzhan po ma yin pa ma yin te / de'i phyir mdo dang 'gal bas skye mched bcu po dag 'byung ba tsam ma yin no //
translated: The elements and derivative form are different in nature, so they are not the same cause.

original: 'o na mdo las gang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las gang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore the ten sources are not merely the elements, since that would contradict the s≈´tras.

original: gal te mig 'byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te mig 'byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
translated: If the eye is not by nature an element,

original: ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: why does the s≈´tra say:

original: mig gi sha'i gong bu la //üîΩsra ba mkhregs par gyur pa ste //
analyzed: mig gi sha'i gong bu la // sra ba mkhregs par gyur pa ste //
translated: In the fleshy eyeüîΩthat which is solid and hard

original: mkhrang ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa //üîΩzhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: mkhrang ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa //üîΩzhes gsungs she na /
translated: is the earth element.

original: de dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit exists without being different from that‚Äù is expanded.

original: de las mig de dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa'i ngang tshul yod pas tha mi dad par 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de las mig de dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa'i ngang tshul yod pas tha mi dad par 'dug pa'o //
translated: Since the eye exists in the mode of being without being different from that, it exists without being different.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gang mig gi sha'i gong bu la //üîΩzhes bya ba la nye bar bstan pa 'di ni sha'i mig gi gong bu gang zhig mig gi dbang po dang lhan cig 'dug cing /
analyzed: gang mig gi sha'i gong bu la // zhes bya ba la nye bar bstan pa 'di ni sha'i mig gi gong bu gang zhig mig gi dbang po dang lhan cig 'dug cing /
translated: The eye is in the fleshy part of the eye.

original: de'i rten du gyur pa de'i yin te /
analyzed: de'i rten du gyur pa de'i yin te /
translated: The eye is in the fleshy part of the eye, which is the fleshy part of the eye that exists together with the eye faculty and is its support.

original: rten la brten pa btags pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir mig ni sha'i gong bu'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rten la brten pa btags pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir mig ni sha'i gong bu'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
translated: The support is designated as the supported.

original: dang ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye is not the nature of the fleshy part of the eye because it is not the nature of something clear.

original: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang mthun par tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang mthun par tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te /
translated: Others say that this is stated in accordance with conventional expressions that accord with worldly convention.

original: 'jig rten na ni de'i rten sha'i gong bu 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bdag nyid can la mig tu 'du shes kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni de'i rten sha'i gong bu 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bdag nyid can la mig tu 'du shes kyi /
translated: In the world, the eye is considered to be the fleshy part of the eye, which is the support of the eye sensefaculty, and which is itself derived from the four primary elements.

original: dbang po la ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dbang po la ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The sensefaculty itself is not considered to be the eye.

original: yang na rgyu mtshan gyi 'dun pa brjod par gzhi'i 'dun pa ma yin par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu mtshan gyi 'dun pa brjod par gzhi'i 'dun pa ma yin par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, if the S≈´tra intends to speak of the cause of the eye, it is the primary elements that are the cause of the eye, not the eye sensefaculty.

original: de las 'byung ba dbang po de dang tha mi dad pa 'dug pa gong bu mtha' dag gi rten gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te mig la sogs pa rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ma yin na dge slong mi 'di ni khams drug pa yin te /
analyzed: de las 'byung ba dbang po de dang tha mi dad pa 'dug pa gong bu mtha' dag gi rten gsungs pa'i phyir ro // gal te mig la sogs pa rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ma yin na dge slong mi 'di ni khams drug pa yin te /
translated: The S≈´tra, in fact, speaks of the support of the whole mass, which is the primary elements, not different from the sensefaculty which arises from them.üîΩIf the eye sensefaculty and the other sensefaculties are not derived from the primary elements, then the S≈´tra is contradicted when it says:

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams yin no zhes bya ba ston pa'i gsung dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams yin no zhes bya ba ston pa'i gsung dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, this person consists of six elements, six bases of contact, twelve sense-spheres and eighteen elements.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa sa la sogs pa las tha dad pa rnams yod na mi 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes brjod par mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa sa la sogs pa las tha dad pa rnams yod na mi 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes brjod par mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: If form and so on and eye and so on were different from earth and so on, it would be illogical to say that this human being is the six elements.

original: mngal du 'jug pa na sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa na sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: But this is stated in order to indicate the basis of the substance of sentient beings entering the womb.

original: mdo ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir @71b 'gal ba med do //üîΩde las nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi ste /
analyzed: mdo ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir @71b 'gal ba med do // de las nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi ste /
translated: There is no contradiction because this s≈´tra is provisional.

original: dang po bstan pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams yod bzhin du khams drug tu gsungs te /
analyzed: dang po bstan pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams yod bzhin du khams drug tu gsungs te /
translated: The six elements are stated while form and so on exist in order to indicate the basis of the substance of sentient beings in the state of kalala and so on.

original: de la 'byung ba bzhi las mig la sogs pa reg pa'i skye mched rnams skye ba'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched de /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba bzhi las mig la sogs pa reg pa'i skye mched rnams skye ba'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched de /
translated: The four primary elements are the source of the eye faculty and so on and the source of the contact base because the element of consciousness is the contact base of mental meeting.
